title: Director of Cardiovascular Services
description: Net 2 Source Inc. is an award-winning total workforce solutions company recognized by Staffing Industry Analysts for our accelerated growth of 300% in the last 3 years with over 5500+ employees globally, with over 30+ locations in the US and global operations in 32 countries. We believe in providing staffing solutions to address the current talent gap Right Talent Right Time Right Place Right Price and acting as a Career Coach to our consultants. Based on your impressive profile, I think you could be a great fit for a role we have open with one of our clients. I am sharing few highlights of the role for your reference. Please find below are the additional details for your reference:Job Title: Director of Cardiovascular ServicesLocation: AUSTIN, TX  78704Duration: Direct Hire Shift Timing: Schedule: 36hrs/ week- Days - Variable shift times per surgical volume and unit needs.  Benefits: St. David's South Austin Medical Center offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include: Comprehensive medical coverage covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation. Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more. Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing 401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service) Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stock Family support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance. Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and more Consumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer Discounts Retirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnerships Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships) Colleague recognition program Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence) Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee-only coverage to full-time and part-time colleagues based on income. Job Summary and Qualifications: The Director maintains 24-hour responsibility for the direction, supervision, coordination and evaluation of activities and performances in the professional practice of the staff in the Cath Lab, Heart and Vascular Unit, Cardiovascular Imaging, and Heart Failure Clinic. Directs and coordinates the Quality Assessment and Improvement activities of these departments. Oversees the development, review and revision of policies, procedures and practice guidelines specific to Cardiac Care of cardiology patients. Is accountable for the financial operation of cardiovascular services.  You will integrate department services with the hospital's primary functions. You will coordinate and integrate services within their department and with other departments. You will develop and implement policies and procedures that guide and support the provision of services. You will recommend a sufficient number of qualified and competent persons to provide care. You will determine the qualifications and competence of department personnel who provide patient care services and who are not licensed independent practitioners. You will continuously assess and improve department and the organization's performance. You will maintain appropriate quality control programs. You will review and approve employee payroll. Assure that payroll sheets are accurately completed and are turned in to the Payroll Department within the specified period. You will assure that new employees receive appropriate orientation to the unit. Unit orientation includes the use of equipment used in the Cath Lab, QA and QI activities and special skills certifications. You will assure that education and training of the Cath Lab staff is ongoing. The Cath Lab education and training is designed to maintain and improve the knowledge and skills associated with the care of cardiology patients and are based on identified learning needs of the staff. In-service or other educational activities are routinely provided for staff. You will assure that staff members are certified to perform the specialized skills required in the cardiovascular departments. (i.e. Moderate Sedation, CPR, Venipuncture, etc.). You will hold at least 6 unit specific staff meetings per year. Meeting content includes discussion of QA and QI activities, identification of problems, proposed solutions, exchange of information, and relevant educational topics. Minutes are written and maintained for all meetings held. You will deal directly with physicians, visitors and/or patients who express concerns or have complaints concerning any aspect of cardiovascular services. Respond professionally and in a kind and understanding manner. Provide written information and follow-up to the Director of Nursing and/or Chief Executive Office when appropriate. You will respond to all code situations in the Cath Lab immediately: (Code Blue, Code Red, etc.). Provide direction and act as a resource to other responders. Assign staff to respond as needed. You will serve as a liaison between the medial staff and nursing. Attempt to meet the needs of medical staff when possible. Forward requests of the medical staff on to the Director of Nursing and/or the Chief Executive Officer. Provide adequate equipment/supplies and other needs to the medial staff. You will assure that policies, procedures, and practice guidelines are written specific to the Cardiac Cath Lab, Heart and Vascular Unit, Cardiovascular Imaging, and Heart Failure Clinic. Policies/procedures/practice guidelines are reviewed at least every two years and are updated as necessary. Education: ACLS, BLS BSN 5+ years of progressive CV leadership Current RN license.Refer and earn Amazon voucher starting from $250,  for the open positions. title: Sr. Videographer/Editor
description: Our client, and nation's leading insures, is seeking an Sr. Videographer/Editor Location: RemotePosition Type: Contract Role Overview:Guy has been with Client for approximately 4 months.  Guy is the Director of Branding and Creative Services.  As Guy was joining, one of the Graphic Designers had left the company.  This left Guy with a vacancy.  He was able to successfully fill that position.  Shortly thereafter, another Visual Designer left to accept a fully remote role.  On the plus side, MMI was able to place Arianna with the group as a consultant and has been able to fill the gap and pick up the slack very nicely.  So, there is some volatility to the group which really comes with the territory for this kind of creative work. Guy has been speaking with his Auto line of business about Video needs.  So, Guy now manages not only the internal talent but also the external talent and helps manage the vendor relationship.  Currently, there is a particular video project that Guy wants to add some new, internal talent to.  Right now, they have a vendor that is responsible for a lot of their animation explainers.  They do a decent job.  However, there is another side of this work that Guy needs to build out that includes these video projects around agent education and agent information.  An example of this would be a project that was designated to create several videos to help insurance agents understand the value of social media for their individual businesses and how to get better at social media as in what to do? How to do it? How to understand social media analytics to improve their posts and message to the public.  This is a service that Client offers to its agents and brokers; these education pieces provide them with ways to grow their businesses.  So, Client has created this web portal in which they house all these videos onto this portal.  They share this out to their agents that in turn can access this information and view a series of 6 videos that include these social media "How top's .  Some of these videos are completed already.  They were started and completed in a "loosely/goosey  kind of way.  This was done pretty quickly by their internal team.  They are pretty rough.  They were done using Canva. Now, Guy wants to redo these videos and make them more professional.  They do not Client want to re-record the voice-overs.  They are sufficient.  However, they want to get the people off-screen as much as possible.  They also want to add some animation that is consistent throughout and branded across the series and finally make these videos a lot more engaging and a lot more interesting.  The average length of these videos are at the 2-3 minutes useful limit. Right at that cusp.  They would perhaps cut the length a bit and make them more engaging and give them that professional touch and polish. Currently, they have 6-9 videos in the portal and Guy wants to add more and sort of templatize the whole look and feel so they can continue to consistently produce these higher quality videos. Skills Ask:This is a combination of technical skills and creative skills.  Someone that can think outside the lines if they were given a script and can create something out of that script. Guy is looking for someone who is skilled in the use of the Adobe tool set.  This will include Adobe Premier and Adobe After Effects.  They are the standard professional industry tools for videography and video creation of motion graphics.  As far as the creative side of things, Guy wants someone that is savvy and skilled enough to be able to look at one of Client's videos and realize that the script will remain the same as will the voice-over, but this videographer will then need to come back with perhaps some storyboards, proof-of-concepts or some animatics and will work through that entire process with Guy until they reach a point that exceeds were they are now.  Then, to templatize this approach to apply to the other videos.  How Are We Qualifying the Candidates Reels?Does your candidate have storytelling abilities through motion?  Can your person take a script and find the nuggets and the opportunities to create visual motion graphics from that script.  For example, if the script said . "9/10 people prefer this product .  This would be a perfect opportunity to do a cut screen or a half-screen to animate 9/10, to generate some type of animated info graphic on screen to engage the viewer.   Project Length:The voice overs are completed.  So, they are looking at 2-3 months with the possibility of extensions for additional work perhaps on a project-by-project basis. 2D Animation? 3D?They focus on 2D animation.  Most of their "Explainer  videos are about education and information.   2D is the initial skill but Guy would also like this person to have the ability to work as a director of sorts if they are doing remote recordings. Years of Experience:This fluctuates.  It could be 3-4 years of experience or 8-10 years.  It all depends on what they have accomplished. This is more of a post-Production individual rather than someone doing the initial shoot.  In Guy's previous position, during the pandemic, they did a lot of webinars.  A lot of talking head thought leadership videos.  They had a great vendor that would get on the phone with the end user and talkthem through the process, so they were really delivering great content in a professional manner; rather than just handing someone something to record on your own time with your own phone and send it to us.  That just does not work. Any Complex Sound Editing:They do work together with music and if there are sound effects Guy wants someone creative so they can make suggestions for those types of things.  The voice-over recording is already there.  Guy will use the voice overs but then have the Talking Heads at the very beginning to introduce the video and then only at the very end during the outro.  Everything else in the middle should be animation. Onboarding:Guy would like to hire in the next week or so. Interview Process: Guy.  One and done. Location:100% Remote Bill Rate:$80-$100/per hour

title: Change Management Consultant
description: Change Management Consultant Highly seasoned professional with specialized change management and Lean skills that is recognized across the organization. Responsible for developing, executing and influencing strategies to build and increase buy-in and executive/senior leadership support for change across all levels of the organization. The primary responsibility of the change manager is to develop and implement change management strategies and plans, that maximize employee adoption and usage of required changes across numerous teams and campuses. The goal is to drive faster adoption, higher ultimate utilization of changes and proficiency with the changes that impact employees. Key Responsibilities: Apply a structured methodology and lead change management activities Leverage a change management methodology, process and tools to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative. Assess the change impact Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness, and identify key stakeholders. title: Director of Software Engineering- Guidewire
description: Stratus Technology Services is seeking a Director of Software Engineering. This individual is going to be responsible for working closely with business stakeholders across the company to understand, prioritize and assist in the production support of mission critical systems. The Software Development Director oversees a team of developers (both internal & external) who architect, analyze, design, develop, integrated, test, implement and maintain a comprehensive system of applications critical to the daily operations. The Director is accountable for the successful delivery of software deliverables and support for the organization. This position is also responsible for the strategic development of the software architecture vision and leadership and all aspects of the development of the software.       Essential Duties and Responsibilities      Develop and deliver a strategic technological vision and direction for the companys system platform.      Oversee the management of daily operations tasks necessary to maintain a high quality, reliable portfolio of applications.      Oversee the vendor relationships for systems development and software that is maintained and/or developed by third parties.      Oversee assigned software architectures ensuring long term maintainability, reliability, and extensibility.      Research and approve new and existing technologies, evaluation of solutions alternatives, development of prototypes and generation of detailed technical requirements.       Develop and implement agile software development methodologies, best practices, and standards to achieve the highest product quality while continuously improving performance and the productivity of the organization.      Define, deploy, and drive sustainable and repeatable process improvements through the entire life cycle.  Prioritize and manage resource allocation for the products based on changing business priorities and budget constraints.      Participate in the prioritization and coordination of systems enhancements, including the coordination of enhancements affecting multiple systems with the organization.      Manage the maintenance and presentation of the systems development roadmap, which provides the long-term vision for the clients IT platforms.      Perform other duties as required.         Education and/or Experience      Bachelor's degree in management information systems, computer science, or equivalent, required. Masters preferred.      10+ years of previous experience in information technology, technical applications, information systems, or equivalent, required.      10+ years of experience in managing people, processes, and tools.      6+ years of experience in programming languages such as Java, ASP.NET, C#.NET or similar technology, required.        Advanced knowledge of the software development life cycle including systems design, programming techniques, databases, servers, problem solving, analytical, research skills and technical documentation required.        Property and Casualty Insurance experience preferred.      Deep understanding of modern web development technologies in front-end and back-end architectures using .NET Visual Studio, JavaScript, CSS, Jquery, SSIS, SSRS, SQL Server      Experience with design patterns, code structure, continuous integration, object-oriented development using MVC, Forms, multi-threat patterns, GitLabs.      Experience in web integration using HTTP, SOAP, JSON, XML, RESTful API.      Deep understanding of Guidewires Insurance Suite of products, i.e., PolicyCenter, BillingCenter and ClaimCenter.      Experience in engineering business process flows.      Technical skills to master application configuration: modifying XML definitions, scripting (JavaScript, VB, etc.), understanding of relational database concepts, and other skills involved with implementing an advanced web application.      Prior integration experience with insurance policy administration systems such as Guidewires Insurance Suite products a plus.      Ability to provide clear direction, technical management & mentorship to managers, developers, and business & data analysts.       Ability and proven track record in architecting large, complex software solutions with a strong understanding of all application layers.       Ability and proven track record working with team on large, complex software systems with a strong understanding of the software development life cycle and project management concepts.       Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Experience working as a part of an agile development team.      Flexible, enthusiastic approach to work including a strong desire to learn. Capable of adapting quickly to new systems and learning, understanding, and applying new technologies.      Energetic and enthusiastic leader. Must be able to see tasks of the team through to completion without significant guidance.      Self-motivated, detail-oriented, energetic, and highly organized leader while remaining flexible & effective under pressure.       Advanced knowledge of SQL databases.      Advanced knowledge of business requirements documentation and technical specifications.      Advanced knowledge of project management tools & techniques.      Must be able to work under tight deadlines efficiently and with high quality.      Must be flexible and able to adapt in a changing business environment.        Licenses and / or Certifications      Certified in Guidewire Configuration required.

title: Senior Salesforce Developer/ Lead - New York, NY / Alpharetta, GA - FTE
description: Role: Sr. Salesforce Developers / Lead Salesforce Developers Location: NYC, NY / Alpharetta, GA (Day one onsite Hybrid mode NO exception).  Duration: FTE/ Fulltime  As a Salesforce Developer, have to work alongside project managers to develop, design, and implement customizable solutions within Salesforce based upon CRM needs. You will also maintain the technical training schedule for the team while ensuring that the security, integrity, and functionality of the application is intact. You should have hands-on development experience with Salesforce (including its configuration tools) and familiarity with Apex and JavaScript. Responsibility:  Meeting with project managers to determine CRM needs. Developing customized solutions within the Salesforce platform. Designing, coding, and implementing Salesforce applications. Creating timelines and development goals. Testing the stability and functionality of the application. Troubleshooting and fixing bugs. Writing documents and providing technical training for Salesforce team. Maintaining the security and integrity of the application software.  Requirements:  Equipped with 5-7 years of heavy development experience on the Salesforce platform (including coding and configuration). Familiar with Apex programming language, JavaScript (a must!). Experienced in using Salesforce configuration tools (e.g., Flows, Process Builder, etc.) and creating Lighting web components that are extensible and reusable (a must!). Proficient with Salesforce's Trigger, Classes and Batch jobs. Familiar with Salesforce Process Automation tools such as Flows, Workflow, Process Builder, Approval Process and Email Templates. Highly understanding of Salesforce's framework of information sharing via Profiles, Permission sets, Public Groups, Sharing Settings and Sharing Rules. Understanding of Salesforce Governing limits. Knowledgeable in Object and Object Relation; you should have a strong data modeling background. Proficient with DML operation, SOQL and SOSL statements. Able to find the right balance between declarative and custom coding to meet business requirements and the desired user experience. Experienced in designing custom end-user solutions. Highly understanding of object-oriented coding standards, design patterns, and similar best practices. Familiar with Agile methodology. Experienced in a Salesforce test driven development (TDD), Familiar with VS Code/SFDX for development. Able to effectively communicate with Product Managers, Business Analysts, Data Developers and Testers. A quick learner with an ability to effectively communicate and coordinate within the team in fast-paced development cycle. Experienced in: Apex, JavaScript, DML, SOQL, SOSL, Lightning Design System/Lightning Web components, Salesforce Mobile, Salesforce Experience Cloud Setup/Configurations, Git/Git-based products such as Bitbucket. Coming from a background in the Financial Services Industry.  Good to have:  Experience in Investment Banking and/or Global Markets (Equities and Fixed Income). Experience with AutoRabbit, Mulesoft, Einstein, JIRA and Confluence. Salesforce Certifications. Experience with Salesforce Communities Setup and Configurations.    Thanks, Sanjay Kumar

title: IT Platform Admin
description: IT Platform Admin IVJob Summary: Talent Software Services is in search of an IT Platform Admin for a Direct Placement position in Rochester, NY.  Position Summary: The IT Platform Admin will act as a liaison between the business and technical resources by ensuring the availability of applications for users. This individual will demonstrate a high-level of responsibility and consistency by contributing to the timely response and closure of incidents received via the corporate incident tracking system. This role will work to identify functionality to empower users. In addition to operating out of an incident queue and application support mailbox during business hours, the IT Platform Admin will perform periodic user audits and may be responsible for completing IT tasks related to performing releases to install, configure, troubleshoot and maintain applications currency. This key individual frequently interacts with multiple departments to advocate for customers' incidents and providing timely responses. Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:All Levels:  Installs, configures, and maintains third-party software tools for IT applications.  Monitors existing systems to provide pro-active support to users.  Comprehends and translates users' needs to facilitate resolution of application issues.  Recreates, troubleshoots, and resolves questions/problems in a professional and timely manner in accordance with the company's service level agreements.  Research complex reporting scenarios, systems incidents, and process flow events as needed.  Provides feedback regarding release documentation to Release Management and development teams.  Assists in maintaining detailed documentation of current revision of applications, procedures and information flow to support enterprise environments.  Implements backup procedures for each IT application that ensure recoverability within negotiated customers specifications.  Participates in on call efforts.  Accurately prepares all documentation to comply with change management controls.  Provides user documentation as needed to resolve issues, including process-flow descriptions and/or Visio diagrams.  Consistently demonstrates high standards of integrity by supporting the Lifetime Healthcare Companies' mission and values, adhering to the Corporate Code of Conduct, and leading to the Lifetime Way values and beliefs.  Maintains high regard for member privacy in accordance with the corporate privacy policies and procedures.  Regular and reliable attendance is expected and required.  Performs other functions as assigned by management.   Level II (in addition to Level I essential responsibilities/accountabilities):  Anticipates and identifies application risks and issues.  Recommends remediation options to prevent issue reoccurrence.  Ability to write and debug Structured Query Language (SQL).   Monitors execution of controls to ensure compliance (i.e. Segregation of Duties). Defines and implements the process to maintain application security.   Develop and validate recovery procedures for each content management application.    Level III (in addition to Level II essential responsibilities/accountabilities):  Meets with the business units to determine the business requirements for maintaining and improving the utilization and functionality of supported application software.   Documents technical specifications for solution designs to address application issues or identified enhancements.   Develops defined standards, policies, procedures.   Serves as technical lead and consulting support to appropriate support groups and internal/external customers.   Drives and manages resolution of application incidents and production issues.  Reviews new application software releases and determines impact to current systems Proactively generates relevant ideas for new and improved use of technology based on knowledge of the corporate business, product and systems, and customer's business needs.  entors less experience incumbents in the functionality of the job.   Level IV (in addition to Level III essential responsibilities/accountabilities):  Acts as trusted advisor to the management team.  Emphasizes technology cost optimization when designing new solutions.  Serves as mentor for peers.  Leads business critical projects efforts for IT infrastructure.  Leads internal strategic efforts and collaborates with peers. Qualifications:Level I:  Associates degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, Analytics or relevant field. In lieu of degree three (3) years of related work experience required. Bachelor's degree preferred.  Basic knowledge of structured systems analysis and design with special emphasis in systems administration, project management, user relations, data integrity and data gathering techniques.  Basic knowledge of relevant operating system.  Basic knowledge of programming/scripting languages.  Basic knowledge of relational database management systems.  Clear and concise communication in both written and verbal form.  Must be able to work independently.  Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines and prioritize and organize workload.   Level II (in addition to Level I minimum qualifications):  Two (2) years of related experience.  Requires thorough knowledge of relevant operating system.  Intermediate knowledge of application(s)/application integration tool(s) administration or relevant technology counterparts. Examples include:   Content Stores (FileNet Content Manager, Content Manager On Demand, Alfresco, Data Lakes)  Content Integration (Content Navigator, WebSphere Application Server, Microsoft IIS, Web Services)  Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) tools (Informatica)  Cloud Infrastructure Services (Azure, AWS, Google)    Intermediate knowledge of relational database management systems.  Intermediate experience of Disaster Recovery.  Intermediate knowledge of security, compliance, and audit policies/procedures.  Experience with IT computing resource management and optimization.  Ability to support Application Development initiatives through research, design, and implementation.    Level III (in addition to Level II minimum qualifications):  Four (4) years of related experience.  Advanced knowledge of application(s)/application integration tool(s) administration listed above.  Possesses extensive knowledge of technologies outside of core administration job function.  Advanced experience of Disaster Recovery.   Ability to provide internal mentorship within team.  Strategic vision in alignment with business objectives.   Level IV (in addition to Level III minimum qualifications):  Six (6) years of related experience.  Possesses extensive knowledge of technologies outside of core administration job function.  Seen as a senior level member from an overall Technology perspective at client.  Demonstrated competence in team leadership/technical leadership, facilitation, and project leadership.  Professional certification in job-related technology preferred.   Physical Requirements:  Ability to complete work in a traditional office environment under fluorescent lighting.  Ability to orally communicate.  Must be able to function while sitting at a desk viewing a computer and using a keyboard and mouse for 3 or more hours at a time. description: Title: Data Acquisition AnalystPosition Type: 3 Month Contract to Likely HireRate: $25-28 per hour, converting to $55-62KLocation: Charlotte, NC (Hybrid, onsite 1-2 days per week)Work Status: s, Holders, or Authorized to work in the US Job summary:Monitor monthly transactional volumes to ensure the accuracy and completeness of data. Work with Distributors to obtain missing data volumes, correct data feed discrepancies, and act as the primary point of contact for data-related issues between Foodbuy and the Distributor. This process ensures the successful capture and processing of Foodbuy customers' purchase transactions and the generation of manufacturer invoices, customer volume allowances, and price audits, resulting in maximum revenue and savings for those customers. Responsibilities: Analyze gaps in distributor spend volumes across various granularities and POV's to ensure the complete ongoing collection of over $25 billion in annual spend data across the U.S. and Canada As the main data relationship owner with our Distribution Partners, perform triage for all data feed needs between various teams and DC s. Qualifications: Completion of Bachelor s degree is preferred 1+ years of role relevant experience preferred.  Relevant college coursework accepted in lieu of experience. Daily application of statistical trend analysis Customer/Stakeholder focused with excellent "follow-up to resolution" skills. Strong collaborator and communicator (via email, phone, video conferencing), able to work cross-functionally to solve problems. Organized, extremely detail-oriented, and analytical in nature. Experience with repetitive data driven and master data processes. Basic understanding of MS Office Suite including advanced Outlook and Excel (Lookups, Pivot Tables, Formulas) Able to track multiple work threads and meet all SLA s.

title: HYBRID - Systems / Network Support Engineer
description: Systems / Network Support Engineer  Location; Los Angeles, CA (Hybrid - work from home / dispatch to clients as needed estimated 3-5 times per week)    JOB DESCRIPTION  As a Systems / Network Support Engineer, you will be responsible for providing technical support to clients of the managed service provider (MSP) company. This includes responding to on-site help desk tickets, troubleshooting hardware and software issues, and implementing solutions to resolve problems. Immediate opening for individuals to join a growing IT managed services firm.  If you are looking for a job with growth potential, this is it, please apply now.     QUALIFICATIONS   4+ years of experience in IT support role   preferably with an MSP.  Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating systems and applications, including Active Directory, Exchange, and Office 365.  General desktop and application troubleshooting. The qualified candidate will have skills in the following:   Desktop support experience, Windows 10, Mac OS  Network printing / scanning  Mobile / smart device experience  Configuration to Exchange / Office 365    Experience with supporting / configuring servers   VMware / Hyper-V.  Familiarity with network infrastructure / routers and troubleshooting tools.  Possess relevant industry certifications, such as CompTIA A+, Network+, or Microsoft MCSA / MCSE, are a plus.  Experience with ConnectWise, Autotask, Kaseya, or any other MSP-centric tools preferred.  Project Management skills / experience   big plus.  Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.  Experience documenting technical procedures and creating knowledge base articles.  Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  Live in a location that is easily accessible to the West Side of Los Angeles.  Able to drive to various clients within 25 miles of Los Angeles - North Orange County 3-5 times a week. Mostly from Santa Monica to City of Commerce to Long Beach Region, for LA technician.  Reliable transportation to travel between client sites (mileage expense will be reimbursed).  Work from home, dispatch to client as needed. Company vehicle or reimbursement will be provided. Must possess clean driving record.    Platinum Resource Group is a professional level consulting firm, providing resources to Fortune 1000 client companies in the areas of technology, human resources, accounting, finance, business systems and supply chain, on a contract and interim basis. PRG has operations in Orange County, San Diego, Los Angeles, and San Francisco. title: Category Manager
description: Category ManagerJob Summary: Talent Software Services is in search of a Professional(Other) - Category Manager for a contract position in Allentown, PA. The opportunity will be one year with a strong chance for a long-term extension.Position Summary: The purpose of this job is to manage the supply chain for a wide variety of corporate requirements and issue contractual commitments with an estimated value of up to client million per year. Responsible for procuring various Design-Build, construction services, engineered equipment, software, engineering services, commodities, construction project resource requirements and indirect services on a best evaluated total cost of ownership basis, and assuring quality and schedule compliance in accordance with the end user's requirements. This position determines contract models and strategies, determines services and material supply chain models, interfaces and communicates with technical subject matter experts and managers, manages inventory levels, administers contracts, conducts negotiations, performs market/price/financial analysis, develops supplier relationships, tracks and manages supplier performance, and drives continuous improvement and productivity with suppliers and customers. This position is an experienced professional that works independently with minimal supervision and may provide guidance and direction to other Client employees in support of high-quality, timely, and cost-effective resource acquisition activities.Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities: Develop negotiation strategies and company positions on complex (multi-million dollar) contracts, work with Office of General Counsel to identify and incorporate appropriate levels of commercial protection, and conduct negotiations to achieve the optimal business results for the company. Perform market analysis and financial analysis to determine business risk associated with a supplier or contract.  Mitigate risk as necessary by using hedges for foreign currency, pursuing performance and payment bonds, or obtaining parental guarantees. Analyze and develop company position on claims and disputes and subsequently consult with senior management to resolve/negotiate claims and disputes associated with complex procurements. Manage the supply chain process from specification/definition of need through contract administration and investment recovery.  Evaluate sources of supply and develop optimal pricing methodology, warranty, and product/service performance requirements.  Determine and utilize the most strategic supply chain model to acquire the necessary products and services at the maximum level of savings. Identify new sources of supply and potentially acceptable new products/technologies.  Establish/maintain professional relationships with suppliers/partners based on the highest ethical business practices as set forth in the Standards of Integrity and Client's Supply Chain Policies. Support complex capital projects (such as substation and line construction) by working with the project management team to develop the contracting strategy, project plan, identify required resources, acquire necessary equipment and services, and manage contract performance. Analyze and evaluate the levels of inventory in support of Electric and Gas Operations.  Determine and maintain appropriate stocking levels (dollars or number of items), and identify the necessary warehousing locations, while at the same time, reducing Client's inventory carrying costs. Be the corporate expert for assigned category, and know the market drivers, supplier base, emerging technologies, regulatory factors, category spend by supplier, inventory, supplier, and fill rate performance.  Exhibit ownership of the entire supply chain for assigned category from cradle to grave. Acts as primary liaison to suppliers within assigned category. The company reserves the right to determine if this position will be assigned to work on-site, remotely, or a combination of both.  Assigned work location may change.  In the case of remote work, physical presence in the office/on-site may be required to engage in face-to-face interaction and coordination of work among direct reports and co-workers. All other duties and projects as assigned.Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in business, engineering, supply chain, or related field or 5 years related experience. Minimum of 2 years of logistics, materials, or services buying experience. Supply Chain and market knowledge of products, equipment, and services. Basic knowledge of business law, commercial terms and conditions, and related legal issues.Note: Must meet all requirements within this section before being considered as a candidate.Preferred: Experience in Electric and Gas Utility supply chain (Distribution and/or Transmission and Substations). Certified Purchasing Manager (C.P.M) or Certified Professional in Supply Management (C.P.S.M). or other Supply Chain Certification. Background in Lean, Six Sigma, or similar process improvement models. Strong negotiation and analytical skills. Effective written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills. Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and databases. Demonstrated problem-assessment and problem-solving skills. Strong customer service focus supporting an operating company, with ability to build credibility with internal clients and external suppliers. Proven project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.If this job is a match for your background, we would be honored to receive your application!Providing consulting opportunities to TALENTed people since 1987, we offer a host of opportunities including contract, contract to hire and permanent placement. description: Title: Sr Network AdministratorLocation: Onsite - Arlington, TXDuration: Direct Hire ($2K sign on bonus)Work Requirements: , Holders or Authorized to Work in the US without the need of sponsorship (either now or in the future) Job Summary:My client relies heavily on its network infrastructure to provide robust and secure connectivity for all its team members and customers.  The Network Administrator will oversee the implementation, organization, and troubleshooting of the network, hardware, software, and underlying communications protocols to maintain security and support business operations.Primary Duties and Responsibilities Monitors the network, ensuring optimal function and minimal downtime. Monitors and analyzes network load including traffic and utilization trends. At least ten years of experience with Dell/Cisco switches required. At least five years of experience with SD-WAN desired (Fortinet preferred) Experience with Azure Cloud networking desired. Experience required in routing and switching experience to include: VRF's, VLAN's, Subnetting, QoS, VPN's, HSRP Experience with VRRP preferred, BFD, Virtual-Link Trunking (Dell), DHCP Pools, ACL's, Content Filtering, NAT & PAT, Loop Detect (Cisco), DHCP Snooping, SSH, VTP, SNMPv3, Radius or Tacacs+, Port Security. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Knowledgeable of TCP/IP protocol use and troubleshooting. Able to set up and configure routers, switches, firewalls, VPN's, printers, fax machines, and other network devices. title: IT Business Analyst
description: Stefanini Group is looking for an Application Support (Developer) - Tier 3 & 4 (Remote) for a globally recognized company!  For interested applicants, click the apply button or you may reach out to Alfher Hidalgo at / for faster processing.    The Service Delivery Analyst is responsible for a broad range of tasks focused on all aspects of application service delivery, including the triaging of complex technical issues involving highly integrated application platforms, the organizing and management of Run+ application functional enhancements and upgrades, business stakeholder relationship management and other assignments focused on delivery of high quality and timely technology support in the higher education space. The individual will apply their knowledge of business process analysis and design and technology to solve client needs. Individual will partner with business owners to deliver technology solutions. Individual will also partner with other members of the IT Organization to develop process improvements that result in more streamlined and effective processes. The Service Delivery Analyst will interact with a wide range of colleagues from Academic Deans to hands-on technology and business professionals across international borders.      This position will understand the technology and information needs of the business to determine which internal and vendor technology solutions are the right solutions for business needs. Working independently, or with a team of colleagues, the Solutions Analyst will design, recommend, plan, develop and support implementation of specific IT solutions to meet tactical and strategic business and IT goals.Responsibilities: -  Executes by applying appropriate methodology and tools to manage assignments in the arena of application service delivery.  - Ensures all project deliverables and outcomes are implemented on time, on budget, and within scope to meet the expectations of the project sponsor and owner.  -  Employs proper management in the areas of project scope, schedule/time, finance, quality, resource, communication, risk, and procurement for successful project outcomes.  -  Develops recommendations, action plans and necessary documentation following the approved project methodology.  -  Develops business requirements by interviewing Subject Matter Experts, gains an understanding of the technology that will be used to provide the solution and documents requirements.  -  Develops Functional Specifications and Designs as needed.  -  Works with assigned technical resources to develop and document technical specifications.  -  Works with IT Service Delivery Manager to ensure Training and Communication plans are developed.  -  Works with business sponsors to ensure that appropriate approvals are gathered at appropriate tollgates.  - Completes other duties as assigned.  - Bachelor's degree in business, technology or related discipline. - 2 - 3 years Project Management experience. Managing and executing multiple projects at once is desired - 2 - 3 years as a Business Analyst - Demonstrated experience with business processes and prior use of a project management system;  Azure DevOps experience a plus- Experience with IT service management and IT service delivery activities is desired. Experience with managing ServiceNow is a plus.  - Prior experience in a software or technology Organization; higher education or academic technology experience a strong plus  - Experience with SharePoint, MS PowerPoint, Excel, and Word required  - Experience supporting projects of medium levels of complexity  - Experience working in an environment which follows a structured development process  - Excellent oral and written communication skills. Must be able to explain complex technical issues in a way that non-technical people can understand. Must be able to explain customer needs and priorities in a way that technical people can understand.- Ability to work with both technical and non-technical team members

description: JOB DESCRIPTION Design and develop various learning solutions including micro learning, e-learning, instructional video, Facilitator guides and tools. Evaluate training needs by pushing out assessments to identify skills or knowledge gaps that need to be addressed. Experience using data/metrics to meet business goals and drive performance improvement. Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal communication abilities. Create and execute on actionable deliverables for the five change management levers: communications plan, sponsor roadmap, coaching plan, training plan, resistance management plan. Experience developing training for Oracle Financials. title: Project Manager
description: Project ManagerJob Summary: Talent Software Services is in search of a Project Manager for a contract position in Blythewood, SC. The opportunity will be twelve months with a strong chance for a long-term extension. Position Summary: Under limited supervision, manages and coordinates IT strategic and tactical assignments and project management activities associated with agency-wide information technology initiatives. Coordinates IT project activities, deliverables, and deadlines with client personnel and other stakeholders, which will include other state and county government agencies and applicable business partners. Position may also serve in co-lead or IT coordinator role for agency projects led by the agency PMO or other business units. client recently created an agency Project Management Office in the Chief of Staff Office. The IT Project Manager will work closely with agency PMO staff on applicable projects involving information technology. Also, the agency PMO is developing standardized project management methodologies; therefore, this position will assist with creating and establishing IT project management standards and processes to align with agency project management standards. Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities: Serves as client's IT project manager for assigned projects.  For non-IT driven projects, role will serve as project manager for IT assigned deliverables. Manages assigned IT projects and coordinates with all stakeholders from inception to completion to achieve the desired outcome. Works with project team to identify and document project scope/charter, budget (where applicable), resources, project schedules including milestones and risks, and project deliverables. Establishes meeting cadence for each project to ensure projects remain on budget and on schedule. Maintains project team accountability through tracking budget, milestones, risk mitigation actions, issues, and task assignments. Escalates issues timely to applicable stakeholder(s). Collaborates with others to establish project meeting agendas and produces project team meeting notes including providing project status updates and reports to stakeholders. Closes out each project in a timely and orderly manner, with documentation of lessons learned and finalizing of essential project documentation. Maintains accurate master IT project list. Produces required IT project related presentation and supplemental materials for meetings including steering committee and strategic planning meetings. Work with IT Management and client Project Management Office to develop, document, and codify the project planning, implementation, and management methodology for adoption by client.Qualifications: Bachelor s degree with minimum 6 years related experience in project management role leading complex information technology projects from project scoping through implementation. A bachelor's degree in business management, public administration, information technology, or other related field of study. A minimum of three (3) years of project management experience is required.  Five (5) or more years of project management experience is preferred.  The majority of project management experience needs to be in managing information technology associated projects. Strong knowledge of best practices for project management principals and methodologies including knowledge of standard project management terminology, as defined in the PMI PMBOK Strong working knowledge of Microsoft project software Strong verbal communication and written skills with the ability to compose clear, concise reports, documents and correspondence. Thorough understanding of information technology concepts, terminology and standards. 5. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships Ability to effectively plan and organize work activities and prioritize task completion according to schedules and goals. Strong knowledge of budgetingPreferred: Ability to lead and influence. Ability to understand and clearly communicate complex projects. Considerable diplomacy and tact exhibited in stressful situations. Employees must develop and maintain knowledge of agency mission, goals and objectives. You will partner closely with various business & engineering teams to drive the adoption, integration with graph technology. This role is a critical element to using the power of data in delivering Fidelity's promise of creating the best customer experiences in financial services! The Team PI Data Engineering team (part of Personal Investing Technology BU) is focused on delivery data and ML solutions for the organization. As part of this team, you will be responsible for building scalable graph database analytics solutions.   The Expertise You Have Bachelor's or master's Degree in a technology related field (e.g. Engineering, Computer Science, etc.). Demonstrable experience in implementing Big data solutions in data analytics space. Hands-on experience with graph databases (Neo4j, or any other). Experience Tuning Graph databases Understanding of graph data model paradigms (LPG, RDF) and graph languages (Gremlin & SparQL are optional), hands-on experience with Cypher is required Solid understanding of graph data modeling, graph schema development, graph data design. Desirable (Optional) skills: Data ingestion technologies (ETL/ELT), Messaging/Streaming Technologies (AWS SQS, Kinesis/Kafka), Relational and NoSQL databases (DynamoDB, EKS, Graph database), API and in-memory technologies. Understanding of developing highly scalable distributed systems using Open-source technologies. Experience with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins or equivalent), version control (Git), orchestration/DAGs tools (AWS Step Functions, Airflow, Luigi, Kubeflow, or equivalent). Experience in Agile methodologies (Kanban and SCRUM).   Thanks, Sanjay Kumar

title: Chemist
description: Chemist - IJob Summary: Talent Software Services is in search of a Chemist for a contract position in Rahway, NJ. The opportunity will be twelve months with a strong chance for a long-term extension.Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities: The Industrial Hygiene Laboratory (IHL) Contract Chemist position will be responsible for analysis of industrial hygiene (IH) samples using HPLC, UPLC, LC/MS/MS and ELISA. Using precise analytical skills and understanding of chemical principles, performs analysis of industrial hygiene (IH) air and surface wipe samples using approved analytical methods. Must have the ability to work independently using sophisticated laboratory instrumentation and associated software applications. The successful candidate will maintain accurate records and comply with laboratory operation and safety SOPs. Working within the requirements of ISO 17025 is expected. The IHL Contract Chemist will demonstrate analytical proficiency initially and then on a continuing basis. The ability to prioritize workload and complete all testing in a timely manner is expected.  Analysis of air and surface samples within our client s expected timeframes. Accurately prepare analytical standards, prepare reagents, set up instruments, and prepare IH samples within the laboratory s procedures Complete data entry for samples, e.g., log samples upon receipt into LIMS, record results into internal Client's IH database. Follow internal procedures to ensure that methods are up to date Perform periodic checks of laboratory equipment and systems, e.g., daily refrigerator & freezer thermometer check, daily desiccator humidity check, weekly eyewash, monthly safety inspections, annual check of pipettes and syringes. Coordinate instrument repairs, as neededQualifications: Bachelor s degree in Chemistry. Master's degree will be considered with appropriate experience At least 1-3 years of hands-on laboratory experience with HPLC/UPLC Experience using Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) and Empower instrument management software (or similar) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Demonstrate attributes consistent with the *** workforce of the future; adaptability, flexibility, teamwork, accountability and innovation.Preferred: Experience in analysis of Industrial Hygiene samples and/or pharmaceutical or life sciences industry within a production-oriented laboratory Experience using immunoassay technology (ELISA, MARIA) and LC/MS/MS to test samples Proficiency in other Microsoft applications - Access, SharePoint, Teams. If this job is a match for your background, we would be honored to receive your application!Providing consulting opportunities to TALENTed people since 1987, we offer a host of opportunities including contract, contract to hire and permanent placement. Let's talk!

Serve as the technical US GAAP subject matter expert on most complex critical areas.* Work closely with the CFO to assume leadership of projects and complex analysis.* Enhance, develop, and implement policies and procedures for core finance functions promoting internal controls.* Provide timely financial statements and reports to senior management and upon request from business unit leaders.* Enable senior management to understand business trends and highlight operating strengths and weaknesses.* Oversee the payroll and financial operations of Company, subsidiary companies, and a foreign operation.* Manage the Company's treasury and prepare cash projections that guide the overall cash planning and financing of business cycles.* Lead year end close process, reviews and approve financial transactions, track R&D expenditures and coordinate with external auditors and service providers.* Manage and mentor accounting professionals and staff to perform their work tasks with optimal efficiencies and in a service-oriented manner.* Establish an ethical and collaborative work environment, promoting accountability and corporate values.* Coordinate with operations, accounting, IT and others to implement process improvements in the accounting department for greater productivity and accuracy in transaction processing.* Optimize bank relationships with favorable terms for credit facilities and banking transactions.* Participate in the development of the company's financial plans and programs as a business partner. Provide technical guidance and advice to others within the organization on financial matters.* Develop and track performance measures that support the company's key success indicators.* Understand and mitigate key elements of the company's risk by implementing appropriate accounting controls.* Advise and guide sales management and procurement managers on establishing favorable financial terms with customers and vendors on large transactions.* Ensure that record keeping meets the requirements of auditors and government agencies.* Manage and ensure the quality of data in the ERP system and related tools.* Update job knowledge by remaining aware of new regulations; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.Position Requirements:* Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance, Masters preferred.* 10+ years of Financial, Accounting and leadership experience, most recently as a Director or VP for a small to mid-sized company (Professional Services, Software, Technology or similar industry preferred).* CPA required and the license must be active.* Prior Management of a large accounting team required.* Advanced Excel ability required. Advanced Word skills preferred.* Self-starter who can multi-task, meet strict deadlines, oversee projects and drive results.* Knowledge of Sage Intacct and ASC 606 revenue recognition a big plus.* Possess excellent and demonstrated strategic financial planning and analysis abilities, extensive and current knowledge of leading edge principles and practices associated with accounting.* Outstanding oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills are essential.* Candidate should be self- assured and able to 'work and play' well with others.* Ability to work in a dynamic, fast paced, proactive environment.* Professional Services, Software, Technology or similar industry preferred.Comp: 165k + 25k bonus*M

title: Laboratory Assistant
description: Stefanini Group is hiring!  Stefanini is looking for Laboratory Assistant in East Hanover, NJ (Onsite)  For quick Apply, please reach out to Cathryn Villanueva -Call: / Email: Cathryn.Villanueva @stefanini.com  We are seeking a Food Manufacturing Associate to join our team at our facility. The ideal candidate will be responsible for various tasks related to food manufacturing, including sample requests, ordering supplies, conducting product evaluations, and assisting with pilot plant trials. The candidate should have a background in food science or CPG experience, although it is not required.  Location: will work at site-must be vaccinated to enter the facility.1. Enter sample requests into company system for analytical and micro analysis.2. Order supplies and ingredients for bench top experiments, pilot plant trials and product sample reviews.3. Assemble and initiate shelf life storage studies and conduct product pull.4. Prepare and ship samples as needed and supply tracking information.5. Aid Product Developers with bench-top sample preparation.6. Utilize various pieces of lab equipment to quantify product attributes and report findings to the Product Developer.7. Enter test data into Excel or other database systems.8. Prepare lab area for product reviews9. Assist with pilot plant trials (Fair Lawn, NJ) as needed, and evaluate the product in lab.10. Be a trusted partner within the lab environment Requirements:Availability to work 5 days a week, totaling approximately 40 hours per week.Shift timing: 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM with a 30-minute lunch break (start time flexibility).Willingness to work overtime if required (rare occurrence).Recommended: Background in food science or CPG experience. Note: This job requires on-site work, and all candidates must be vaccinated to enter the facility.  ***Listed salary ranges may vary based on experience, qualifications, and local market. Also, some positions may include bonuses or other incentives*** Stefanini takes pride in hiring top talent and developing relationships with our future employees. Our talent acquisition teams will never make an offer of employment without having a phone conversation with you. Those face-to-face conversations will involve a description of the job for which you have applied. We also speak with you about the process including interviews and job offers. About Stefanini Group The Stefanini Group is a global provider of offshore, onshore and near shore outsourcing, IT digital consulting, systems integration, application, and strategic staffing services to Fortune 1000 enterprises around the world. Our presence is in countries like the Americas, Europe, Africa, and Asia, and more than four hundred clients across a broad spectrum of markets, including financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical services, technology, public sector, and utilities. Stefanini is a CMM level 5, IT consulting company with a global presence. We are a CMM Level 5 company.

title: HYBRID - Systems / Network Support Engineer
description: Systems / Network Support Engineer  Location; Los Angeles, CA (Hybrid - work from home / dispatch to clients as needed estimated 3-5 times per week)    JOB DESCRIPTION  As a Systems / Network Support Engineer, you will be responsible for providing technical support to clients of the managed service provider (MSP) company. This includes responding to on-site help desk tickets, troubleshooting hardware and software issues, and implementing solutions to resolve problems. Immediate opening for individuals to join a growing IT managed services firm.  If you are looking for a job with growth potential, this is it, please apply now.     QUALIFICATIONS   4+ years of experience in IT support role   preferably with an MSP.  Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating systems and applications, including Active Directory, Exchange, and Office 365.  General desktop and application troubleshooting. The qualified candidate will have skills in the following:   Desktop support experience, Windows 10, Mac OS  Network printing / scanning  Mobile / smart device experience  Configuration to Exchange / Office 365    Experience with supporting / configuring servers   VMware / Hyper-V.  Familiarity with network infrastructure / routers and troubleshooting tools.  Possess relevant industry certifications, such as CompTIA A+, Network+, or Microsoft MCSA / MCSE, are a plus.  Experience with ConnectWise, Autotask, Kaseya, or any other MSP-centric tools preferred.  Project Management skills / experience   big plus.  Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.  Experience documenting technical procedures and creating knowledge base articles.  Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  Live in a location that is easily accessible to the West Side of Los Angeles.  Able to drive to various clients within 25 miles of Los Angeles - North Orange County 3-5 times a week. Mostly from Santa Monica to City of Commerce to Long Beach Region, for LA technician.  Reliable transportation to travel between client sites (mileage expense will be reimbursed).  Work from home, dispatch to client as needed. Company vehicle or reimbursement will be provided. Must possess clean driving record.    Platinum Resource Group is a professional level consulting firm, providing resources to Fortune 1000 client companies in the areas of technology, human resources, accounting, finance, business systems and supply chain, on a contract and interim basis. PRG has operations in Orange County, San Diego, Los Angeles, and San Francisco. As a W-2 employer we offer our consultants direct deposit bi-weekly payroll, health, dental, vision benefits, paid holidays, and referral bonuses.

title: Category Manager
description: Category ManagerJob Summary: Talent Software Services is in search of a Professional(Other) - Category Manager for a contract position in Allentown, PA. The opportunity will be one year with a strong chance for a long-term extension.Position Summary: The purpose of this job is to manage the supply chain for a wide variety of corporate requirements and issue contractual commitments with an estimated value of up to client million per year. Responsible for procuring various Design-Build, construction services, engineered equipment, software, engineering services, commodities, construction project resource requirements and indirect services on a best evaluated total cost of ownership basis, and assuring quality and schedule compliance in accordance with the end user's requirements. This position determines contract models and strategies, determines services and material supply chain models, interfaces and communicates with technical subject matter experts and managers, manages inventory levels, administers contracts, conducts negotiations, performs market/price/financial analysis, develops supplier relationships, tracks and manages supplier performance, and drives continuous improvement and productivity with suppliers and customers. This position is an experienced professional that works independently with minimal supervision and may provide guidance and direction to other Client employees in support of high-quality, timely, and cost-effective resource acquisition activities.Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities: Develop negotiation strategies and company positions on complex (multi-million dollar) contracts, work with Office of General Counsel to identify and incorporate appropriate levels of commercial protection, and conduct negotiations to achieve the optimal business results for the company. Perform market analysis and financial analysis to determine business risk associated with a supplier or contract.  Mitigate risk as necessary by using hedges for foreign currency, pursuing performance and payment bonds, or obtaining parental guarantees. Analyze and develop company position on claims and disputes and subsequently consult with senior management to resolve/negotiate claims and disputes associated with complex procurements. Manage the supply chain process from specification/definition of need through contract administration and investment recovery.  Evaluate sources of supply and develop optimal pricing methodology, warranty, and product/service performance requirements.  Determine and utilize the most strategic supply chain model to acquire the necessary products and services at the maximum level of savings. Identify new sources of supply and potentially acceptable new products/technologies.  Establish/maintain professional relationships with suppliers/partners based on the highest ethical business practices as set forth in the Standards of Integrity and Client's Supply Chain Policies. Support complex capital projects (such as substation and line construction) by working with the project management team to develop the contracting strategy, project plan, identify required resources, acquire necessary equipment and services, and manage contract performance. Analyze and evaluate the levels of inventory in support of Electric and Gas Operations.  Determine and maintain appropriate stocking levels (dollars or number of items), and identify the necessary warehousing locations, while at the same time, reducing Client's inventory carrying costs. Be the corporate expert for assigned category, and know the market drivers, supplier base, emerging technologies, regulatory factors, category spend by supplier, inventory, supplier, and fill rate performance.  Exhibit ownership of the entire supply chain for assigned category from cradle to grave. Acts as primary liaison to suppliers within assigned category. The company reserves the right to determine if this position will be assigned to work on-site, remotely, or a combination of both.  Assigned work location may change.  In the case of remote work, physical presence in the office/on-site may be required to engage in face-to-face interaction and coordination of work among direct reports and co-workers. All other duties and projects as assigned.Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in business, engineering, supply chain, or related field or 5 years related experience. Minimum of 2 years of logistics, materials, or services buying experience. Supply Chain and market knowledge of products, equipment, and services. Basic knowledge of business law, commercial terms and conditions, and related legal issues.Note: Must meet all requirements within this section before being considered as a candidate.Preferred: Experience in Electric and Gas Utility supply chain (Distribution and/or Transmission and Substations). Certified Purchasing Manager (C.P.M) or Certified Professional in Supply Management (C.P.S.M). or other Supply Chain Certification. Background in Lean, Six Sigma, or similar process improvement models. Strong negotiation and analytical skills. Effective written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills. Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and databases. Demonstrated problem-assessment and problem-solving skills. Strong customer service focus supporting an operating company, with ability to build credibility with internal clients and external suppliers. Proven project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.If this job is a match for your background, we would be honored to receive your application!Providing consulting opportunities to TALENTed people since 1987, we offer a host of opportunities including contract, contract to hire and permanent placement. Let's talk!

title: Sr Network Administrator
description: Title: Sr Network AdministratorLocation: Onsite - Arlington, TXDuration: Direct Hire ($2K sign on bonus)Work Requirements: , Holders or Authorized to Work in the US without the need of sponsorship (either now or in the future) Job Summary:My client relies heavily on its network infrastructure to provide robust and secure connectivity for all its team members and customers.  The Network Administrator will oversee the implementation, organization, and troubleshooting of the network, hardware, software, and underlying communications protocols to maintain security and support business operations.Primary Duties and Responsibilities Monitors the network, ensuring optimal function and minimal downtime. Monitors and analyzes network load including traffic and utilization trends. Ensures networks are protected from physical harm, viruses, unauthorized users, and damage to data by developing and monitoring security. Perform troubleshooting analysis of network infrastructure and associated systems. Drafts checklists, processes, and communications for technical and non-technical staff. Creates and ensures that appropriate network documentation exists, including operational instructions and security auditing requirements. Supports internal and external audits related to network policy rules and change management processes for the organization. Maintains smooth operation of LAN/WAN/VPNs. Assists in planning, designing, configuring, and installing network hardware. Performs other duties as assigned.Education and Experience Required At least ten years of network administration experience required. At least ten years of experience with Dell/Cisco switches required. At least five years of experience with SD-WAN desired (Fortinet preferred) Experience with Azure Cloud networking desired. CCNA, Network+, and/or similar certifications a plus.Skills and Abilities Required Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills. Experience required in routing and switching experience to include: VRF's, VLAN's, Subnetting, QoS, VPN's, HSRP Experience with VRRP preferred, BFD, Virtual-Link Trunking (Dell), DHCP Pools, ACL's, Content Filtering, NAT & PAT, Loop Detect (Cisco), DHCP Snooping, SSH, VTP, SNMPv3, Radius or Tacacs+, Port Security. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Knowledgeable of TCP/IP protocol use and troubleshooting. Able to set up and configure routers, switches, firewalls, VPN's, printers, fax machines, and other network devices. title: IT Business Analyst
description: Stefanini Group is looking for an Application Support (Developer) - Tier 3 & 4 (Remote) for a globally recognized company!  For interested applicants, click the apply button or you may reach out to Alfher Hidalgo at / for faster processing.    The Service Delivery Analyst is responsible for a broad range of tasks focused on all aspects of application service delivery, including the triaging of complex technical issues involving highly integrated application platforms, the organizing and management of Run+ application functional enhancements and upgrades, business stakeholder relationship management and other assignments focused on delivery of high quality and timely technology support in the higher education space. The individual will apply their knowledge of business process analysis and design and technology to solve client needs. Individual will partner with business owners to deliver technology solutions. Individual will also partner with other members of the IT Organization to develop process improvements that result in more streamlined and effective processes. The Service Delivery Analyst will interact with a wide range of colleagues from Academic Deans to hands-on technology and business professionals across international borders.      This position will understand the technology and information needs of the business to determine which internal and vendor technology solutions are the right solutions for business needs. Working independently, or with a team of colleagues, the Solutions Analyst will design, recommend, plan, develop and support implementation of specific IT solutions to meet tactical and strategic business and IT goals.Responsibilities: -  Executes by applying appropriate methodology and tools to manage assignments in the arena of application service delivery.  - Ensures all project deliverables and outcomes are implemented on time, on budget, and within scope to meet the expectations of the project sponsor and owner.  -  Employs proper management in the areas of project scope, schedule/time, finance, quality, resource, communication, risk, and procurement for successful project outcomes.  -  Develops recommendations, action plans and necessary documentation following the approved project methodology.  -  Develops business requirements by interviewing Subject Matter Experts, gains an understanding of the technology that will be used to provide the solution and documents requirements.  -  Develops Functional Specifications and Designs as needed.  -  Works with assigned technical resources to develop and document technical specifications.  -  Works with IT Service Delivery Manager to ensure Training and Communication plans are developed.  -  Works with business sponsors to ensure that appropriate approvals are gathered at appropriate tollgates.  - Completes other duties as assigned.  - Bachelor's degree in business, technology or related discipline. - 2 - 3 years Project Management experience. Managing and executing multiple projects at once is desired - 2 - 3 years as a Business Analyst - Demonstrated experience with business processes and prior use of a project management system;  Azure DevOps experience a plus- Experience with IT service management and IT service delivery activities is desired. Experience with managing ServiceNow is a plus.  - Prior experience in a software or technology Organization; higher education or academic technology experience a strong plus  - Experience with SharePoint, MS PowerPoint, Excel, and Word required  - Experience supporting projects of medium levels of complexity  - Experience working in an environment which follows a structured development process  - Excellent oral and written communication skills. Must be able to explain complex technical issues in a way that non-technical people can understand. Must be able to explain customer needs and priorities in a way that technical people can understand.- Ability to work with both technical and non-technical team members

Experience working with on- and off-shore talent. An understanding of Financial Services, Wealth Management and Fintechs. An understanding of UX Design and research.
