title: Governance Risk Compliance
description: Title: (Governance Risk Compliance)Location: (Boca Raton, FL)Duration: (12 Plus months)Compensation: ($75-$90/hr )Work Requirements: , Holders or Authorized to Work in the US The management, assessment, and mitigation of risks are fundamental components of our information assurance and cyber security program at the Florida Turnpike Enterprise. This position leads the IT security risk and audit program for information systems security using generally accepted standards and frameworks for IT audit and risk management (e.g., NIST, ISO, PCI, and ISACA). The position is responsible for the development and implementation of the IT security risk and audit strategy that perform information systems and business process risk assessments and evaluate the effectiveness of technical, physical, and administrative controls to identify control weakness. This individual will interface with the Security Operations, IT Operations, and various business units to: Perform PCI, ISO, COBIT, and applicable State of Florida cybersecurity controls-related reviews to ensure that current, new, and technology infrastructure complies with these standards and Department's security policies. Plan and perform IT security controls effectiveness quarterly reviews. Manage remediation efforts for the identified gaps including assessment of new or enhanced implemented controls. Maintain IT security risk and compliance matrix and performs management reporting. This will include IT systems controls, and business process risks to meet compliance requirements. Provide risk mitigation strategies Maintain Third Party Risk Management Program (TPRM) and analyze SOC-2 and other reporting including mapping to key IT security and compliance controls such as NIST, PCI, and COBIT. Manage IT security vulnerabilities management program aligned with PCI and NIST standards. Identifying and ranking the value, sensitivity, and criticality of the operations and assets that could be affected should a threat materialize in order to determine which operations and assets are the most important. For the most critical and sensitive assets and operations, estimating the potential losses or damage that could occur if a threat materializes, including recovery costs. Identifying cost-effective actions to mitigate and reduce risk. These actions can include implementing new organizational policies and procedures as well as the design of technical or physical controls. Coordinating, tracking, and verifying remediation of audit findings. Documenting the results and developing a plan of action and milestones for mitigating any identified risk. Produce formal audit reports based on ISACA Audit Standards. Promotes compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g. PCI DSS) and IT best practices.GRC Risk Analyst Skills & Requirements: 7-10 years of IT Audit experience (CISA certified preferred) 3 years of IT Risk Management lifecycle experience 3 years of hands-on technical experience (e.g. developer, system administrator) Experience working with NIST 800-30 Risk Assessment Standard Extensive experience with IT General Controls evaluation and design Advanced skill level in business process mapping and documentation as well as policy and procedure development Recent experience in Information Security with up-to-date knowledge of the current threat landscape. Solid understanding of PCI DSS standardsEducation and Certifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field and/or equivalent work experience. CISA and CISSP certifications (preferred).Our benefits package includes: (EXCLUDE on perm placements) Comprehensive medical benefits Competitive pay, 401(k) Retirement plan  and much more! title: Senior Cybersecurity Specialist  - TS/SCI Required
description: Are you qualified with this level of clearance; but are not near Charlottesville?  Ask About Relocation; send an email to  and state that you are applying and that you are interested in relocation assistance to Charlottesville VA.  Are you a seasoned cybersecurity professional with a deep understanding of securing computer systems and a strong background in accreditation activities? Do you possess a wealth of experience in achieving cybersecurity assessment and authorization in compliance with DoD and Army policies? If so, we invite you to join our team as a Senior Cybersecurity Specialist at NGIC's Charlottesville, VA location.Key Responsibilities:As a Senior Cybersecurity Specialist, you will play a crucial role in maintaining the security posture of NGIC's computer systems and ensuring compliance with the highest cybersecurity standards. Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:  Cybersecurity Assessment and Authorization (A&A): Lead and participate in the process of achieving cybersecurity assessment and authorization for systems within the NGIC environment. Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure systems are compliant with relevant DOD and Army cybersecurity policies and instructions.   Security Plan Development: Create and maintain comprehensive security plans that outline the security controls and measures to protect NGIC's information systems. Ensure plans are aligned with industry standards, such as NIST 800-53, and are tailored to the organization's specific needs.   Risk Management Framework (RMF): Utilize your expertise in the RMF to guide the assessment, mitigation, and documentation of risks associated with NGIC's IT environment. Apply RMF principles to drive continuous improvement in security posture.   Compliance Standards Application: Apply your in-depth knowledge of compliance standards, including NIST 800-53 and DISA STIGs, to assess and enhance the security of large and complex IT environments. Develop strategies to align systems with these standards.   Vulnerability Management: Leverage vulnerability management tools such as Nessus and Prisma cloud compute to identify and remediate potential vulnerabilities in NGIC's systems. Play a pivotal role in maintaining a secure infrastructure.   eMASS Utilization: Utilize eMASS tools effectively to manage and track the documentation, assessments, and authorization processes related to cybersecurity activities.   Operating Systems Expertise: Demonstrate proficiency in both Linux and Windows operating systems to address security concerns and implement protective measures.   Communication Skills: Exhibit strong written and verbal communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, articulate cybersecurity requirements, and present findings to leadership. Qualifications and Experience: Clearance: TS/SCI Clearance Required. Certification: DoD 8570.01M IAT Level II Certification (Security+ most common). Experience: At least five years of hands-on experience securing computer systems, performing accreditation activities, and/or writing security plans. Cybersecurity A&A: Minimum of two years of experience in achieving cybersecurity assessment and authorization. Policy Familiarity: Thorough understanding of DOD and Army Cybersecurity policies and instructions. Framework Proficiency: Strong familiarity with the Risk Management Framework (RMF), NIST 800-53, and DISA STIGs. Compliance Application: Proven experience applying compliance standards to large and complex IT environments. eMASS and Tools: Proficiency with eMASS tools and experience with vulnerability management tools such as Nessus and Prisma cloud compute. Operating Systems: Strong experience with both Linux and Windows Operating Systems. Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills.M any of DSA's positions require the ability to obtain a security clearance. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. title: W2 - Sr IT Systems Engineer (JavaScript, SQL Server) - Remote
description: Duties: Position Overview: (Major Functions and Non-Essential Functions):  Under general supervision and guidance, the Senior IT Systems Engineer is responsible for the maintenance and support of moderately complex systems software and hardware computer systems at multiple client sites. Actively monitor and respond to technical hardware and software problems utilizing hardware and software testing tools and techniques as well as assist in managing overall system capacity. May Interface with vendor support service groups or other external support teams to ensure proper escalation during outages or periods of degraded system performance. Expected to contribute to the selection, implementation, and maintenance of custom system software, and/or the installation and maintenance of purchased systems software, plus the configuration and support of hardware systems across client. May also be asked to evaluate new products/technologies to determine impact on existing system configurations; assist with cost/benefit analysis, and feasibility studies; and assist in preparation and presentation of proposals that consider alternatives and business case gains needed for comprehensive institutional consideration. Required to produce and maintain documentation such as systems requirements, designs, resource inventories and plans as requested by the work unit leadership. Works effectively across departmental organizations gaining consensus of stakeholders. Work will be reviewed for quality, timeliness, and adequacy at predetermined milestones. Develops and maintains effective relationships with the I.T. technical staff and management across all client sites in the support of multiple projects simultaneously. May be asked to perform consulting tasks or act as an information resource and/or mentor both internally and externally to the work unit. Consistently demonstrates the ability to take responsibility and accountability for managing work with little or no direct supervision. Demonstrated ability to multi-task and prioritize issues appropriately. Must have demonstrated the ability to interact effectively with a variety of personnel at multiple sites. Candidates must demonstrate proficient verbal and written communication skills using English. Occasional weekends and evening coverage will be required. Participation in 24 x 7 on-call rotation also required. Must be able to see and hear within normally acceptable standards.  Skills: Additional Experience and/or Qualifications: (Has Achieved Competency in the Following Areas, Job Knowledge and Additional Considerations): Experience working in healthcare technology. Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering or related field; Master's degree in a relevant technical discipline helpful. MCSE, CCNA, or other IT related certifications.   Qualified candidates should have demonstrated experience in managing operating systems, including configuration, internals, and maintenance processes. Qualified candidates should have knowledge of system design principles, software development methodologies, project management methodologies, and some computer programming and/or system support experience. Experience managing both custom developed and vendor-supplied applications helpful. Advanced knowledge of multiple operating systems, including configuration, internals, and maintenance processes.   A working knowledge of the following is preferred: Client/Server application architecture, Clustering, VB and scripting tools; MS SQL Server, Oracle, My SQL, DB2 or Sybase; Web Architecture including HTML, JavaScript, Active Server Pages (ASP), PHP; Network topologies and protocols e.g. IEEE 802.3, 802.11a/b/g, 802.1x, TCP/IP; SAN, NAS, virtualized storage environments. Experience in system hardware design, ordering, configuration, testing and implementation of large projects. Proficient verbal and written communication skills using English.  Education: Minimum Education and/or Experience Required: (Education Requirements and Experience): This position requires a Bachelor's degree plus 3 years of demonstrated technical experience or an Associate degree plus 5 years of demonstrated technical experience. A high school diploma and 7 years of demonstrated IT technical experience focused on managing operating systems, including configuration, internals, and maintenance processes in a large, complex organization like client may be considered in lieu of the degree.  Required Skills: JAVASCRIPT, MS SQL SERVER  Hours Per Day: 8.00 Hours Per Week: 40.00   Pay range - $40 to $46 per hour on W2.

title: Senior Electronics System Engineer
description: THE EMPLOYERTake your career up a few notches with this is an American-based designer and manufacturer of electric, electro-hydraulic and hydraulic motion, controls and systems for applications in aerospace, defense, industrial and medical devices.THE JOBOur company is looking for a Sr. Electronics System Engineer to develop Flight Control Computers (FCCs), Actuator Control Units (ACUs), and Motor Control Electronics (MCEs) for primary and secondary flight control systems for military aircraft.  You will be a technical leader with for electronic design.  Reporting to an Engineering manager, you will have a 9/80 schedule option with a hybrid work schedule (3 days/week in the office) in Torrance, CA.  This position may also be based in Salt Lake City, UT (9/80 schedule available). As a Senior Electronics System Engineer your roles and responsibilities will include:Represent the company as a recognized technical authority and project leader.Guide the evolution of the conceptual and detailed design phases through verification and certification.Be a technical reference point for internal and external communications.Conduct systematic capture, development and documentation of verifiable electronics box level requirements that acknowledges technical, schedule, and cost constraints through consulting with customers, staff and sales personnel.Conduct functional analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate systems requirements allocated to electronics into electronic hardware specifications. Communicate these internal design requirements to the other members of the design team.Create detailed Verification and Validation plans and procedures for testing electronic boxes. Investigate and create new test methods and approaches.Conduct hardware and software level integration and test including any performance anomalies investigations.Create concise reports that document the design decisions and analysis results.Support aspects of technical project planning, including designs, proposals, cost estimates, schedules, and technical interface meetings throughout the program lifecycleMake presentations to customers to support design reviews and technical interface meetings.Support project status briefings with clear reports and presentationsContribute to the development of new product requirements through consulting with customers and sales personnel.Represent the company in a manner consistent with its leading-edge technical reputation.Support programs with some travel (5-10%) and the participation in presentations to customersDESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEMost importantly, you need to be a passionate Senior Electronics System Engineer who enjoys his work and is considered to be one of the best within your organization. The ideal Senior Electronics System Engineer would be someone with deep experience in many (if not all) of the following:10+ years of design and development engineering work experience5+ years of experience in the design, analysis, and development of electromechanical systems/components5+ years of project/team leadership experienceExperience with military standards (MIL-STD-461, MIL-STD-704, MIL-STD-810, and RTCA/DO-254 standards),We understand that even if you are a seasoned Senior Electronics System Engineer you may not have all the skills listed here. If you are a good at what you do and have a willingness to learn, lets talk.ADDITIONAL INFORMATIONCompensation: Based on Experience. One of the best in the industryMinimum Education: BS Degree in Electrical EngineeringMinimum Experience: 10+ years of design and development engineering work experienceType of position: Full time Permanent Position with benefitsTelecommute: NoLocation: Torrance, CA | Salt Lake City, UTRelocation accepted: Yes

title: Enterprise Data Platform Senior Project Manager/Scrum Master
description: Job DescriptionLooking for senior project manager/scrum master with marketing and data analytics experience for an initial six month contract with possible extensions or conversion to a permanent employee of our client. Candidates should have project experience with enterprise data platforms and migrating to the cloud. The preference is for the candidate to work a hybrid schedule spending some time onsite in southern Maine to collaborate with coworkers and some time working remotely.  We have an immediate need for an IT Sr Project Manager with a focus on Marketing and Data Analytics related domains. The primary responsibility of this role will be Project Manager / Scrum Master for implementation and build of our Enterprise Data Platform - a cloud-based data and analytics environment. The IS Sr Project Manager works under minimal supervision to plan, direct and coordinate activities of large, long-term, inter-departmental infrastructure or development project(s) to ensure goals and objectives of the project(s) are accomplished within prescribed timeframe and budgetary parameters.   This is initially a remote position with the opportunity to collaborate with the team in-person at our headquarters in southern Maine.  Candidates must have recent, real-world agile project management experience.  The initial contract is 6 months with the possibility of an extension based on performance.   Responsibilities: Communication and Presentation -  Keeps stakeholders, including management, informed of progress to goal; negotiate adjustments to the schedule and resources to ensure overall quality of completed project - Functions as central point for all project communications -  Leverages most effective means of communication based on situation/urgency -   Develops and delivers presentation content to drive understanding and alignment across Team and Project Sponsors (Governance structure)  Establishes Effective Project Governance -  Identifies and facilitates acquiring a Sponsor role that is executed at the appropriate level of the organization -   Identifies and facilitates acquiring a Steering Group that is the Sponsor while representing cross-functional perspective with common project goals -  Identifies and facilitates acquiring a Stakeholder Group that represents and can influence project direction and deliverables  Vendor Management -   Collaborates to develop a positive relationship between client and vendor(s) to ensure successful project deliverables. -   Negotiates contracts and Non-Disclosure Agreements with vendors and monitors project deliverables. Transitions vendor contracts to internal support owner to ensure understanding and compliance with service level agreements. -   Tracks and maintains vendor deliverable costs  Risk Management -  Identifies & analyzes project risks to determine highest potential risk exposure that should be proactively managed -  Identifies & focuses resolution of issues and risks using appropriate levels of escalation considering impact to scope, schedule, budget or quality.  Project Detail and Schedules -   Develops a project work breakdown structure -  Develops and manages a project schedule/timeline using approved Project Management tools (Clarity, Jira, Sharepoint, etc.) -  Develops, monitors, and manages the project staffing plan and resource allocations approved by resource managers -   Determines Resource Assignments with task estimates (ETC's)

title: Hybrid Network Manager
description: Responsibilities          Planning and Development          :        Assists the IT Infrastructure Team with short and long-term planning by preparing recommendations of network infrastructure solutions and services. Effectively applies technical knowledge to identify cost-effective solutions that provide high availability to meet business requirements. Exhibits a high degree of analytical ability and independence in completing these assignments. Includes leadership of all staff and budget for Department.       Design and Implementation     :        Works with vendors, IT staff and facility leads to design and implement network solutions to meet business needs. Routinely completes complex design and implementation assignments involving LAN/WAN/WLAN routers, switches, firewalls, controllers, access points and circuits. Keeps business continuity and interoperability in mind when designing solutions. Proactively communicates and collaborates with external and internal customers to analyze network requirements and deliver solutions on time and within budget.           Network Monitoring and Administration     :        Monitors, controls and maintains network operations including communications to remote locations. Responds to user problems, diagnoses problems using network system tools, recommends solutions and coordinates repair efforts. Provides for work order generation, moves, adds, changes, fault prediction, trouble detection and correction, traffic measurement, circuit analysis, path testing, and maintenance.           Information Security          :        Assists with data security, disaster recovery, firewall and web security, and change control management of IT systems.           Documentation and Testing          :        Carefully prepares and/or reviews materials and approaches to ensure work is complete and conforms to company standards. Types of documentation may include project plans, diagrams, policy, contracts, procedures, customer, internal support and technical. Ensures the quality of systems delivered by completing testing and phased rollout testing if appropriate.       Customer Support          :        Routinely sought after to assist in troubleshooting complex network issues. Demonstrated ability to lead co-workers through network issues to improve their expertise, independence and confidence. Conveys a strong sense of urgency related to problem solving and meeting customer needs. Follows-up with customers in a timely and professional manner. Administers systems to ensure they function accurately and reliably. Network administration tasks may include configuration changes, firmware, security and software updates, hardware replacement, other maintenance tasks and coordinating vendor support agreement activities and contracts. Rotates on-call with other team members to troubleshoots and resolve production problems.          Other Duties & Responsibilities       Support and backup other IT and/or services as needed and other duties as assigned.        OE/Lean       Actively participates in the implementation of sustainable improvement processes, such as 5S, Kaizen, Total Productive Maintenance (TPM), Daily Management Control, Standard Work and Problem Solving.          Qualifications         Education:   BS or BA degree in computer science or related field.   Relevant expert level networking certifications (CCIE, JNCIE, etc) a must.          Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:            8+ years of experience in network design, implementation, and management               8+ years of experience supporting WAN/LAN/WLAN networks at an L3 level               3+ years of experience in implementing and supporting SDN, SD-WAN, and Cloud (preferably Azure) technology               3+ years of experience in implementing and supporting Fortinet firewall and suite of applications               3+ years of experience in implementing and supporting Meraki (Switches and Wireless) or similar products               Expert level multi-vendor experience with routing and switching equipment from Cisco, Juniper               Expert level understanding of, and experience with, TCP/IP, IPv4/IPv6, IPVPN, IPSEC, BGP, EIGRP, OSPF               Expert level understanding of MPLS, VPN and telecommunications architectures.               Understanding of QoS implementation strategies and VOIP optimization,               Experience supporting and troubleshooting Wireless LAN Architecture. Familiarity with Aruba Wireless Networks a plus.               Experience with network management, diagnostic and monitoring tools such as, PRTG, Rancid               Ability to diagnose complex network problems, determine and remediate the root cause. In depth knowledge of layer 4 7 troubleshooting (from a networking perspectivei.e. when an app can't connect)               Strong analytical and problem-solving skills related to networking, connectivity, and are essential.               Roll up your sleeves and get the work done with limited resources.               The incumbent should fully understand the role of computer networking and Information Technology in a manufacturing organization.               Must have the ability to express complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing, and the ability to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience.              Employee must have exemplary communication (both oral and written), skills. Must be a highly motivated self-starter, with outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to work independently and take ownership of a process. Must be able to work in a team matrix environment, encouraging information sharing and knowledge seeking, and must possess business skills and have the ability to transfer these skills to others.     Employee must have good strong customer service skills; be able to sense and respond appropriately to the feelings, needs and concerns of others. Proven ability to gather critical information and the ability to quickly diagnose problems and provide an immediate solution or escalate the problem to the accountable technical resources for a solution definition, ensuring that the support process loop includes communication back to the customer.        The employee is expected to be self-directed, take initiative and be persistent when appropriate to accomplish necessary duties and keep busy without prompting. Additionally, the employee is expected to be adaptable/flexible to changing work assignments, analytical, organized and detail-oriented, perform multiple tasks at once, compose correspondence and other documentation in a professional manner, express ideas constructively, actively listen to others, manage time effectively and efficiently to meet deadlines, learn and memorize procedures, display a cooperative attitude, read, understand and follow all company, job specific and safety policies/procedures, and attend/use all required training.          Travel:         Travel may occur domestically and internationally as required

title: Business Analyst (Hybrid)
description: Job Title: Business Analyst (Hybrid) Location:  Indianapolis, IN Duration:  6+ Months Job Type:  Corp-Corp / 1099 / Contract W2 Rate: $40/hr. on C2C Client: State of Indiana Interview Type: Webcam only Note: Preference will be given to candidates currently located in Indiana    Job Description:  The NEDSS Base System (NBS) is an integrated information system that helps local, state, and territorial public health departments manage reportable disease data and sends notifiable disease data to the CDC.  The NEDSS Base System (NBS) is an integrated information system that helps local, state, and territorial public health departments manage reportable disease data and sends notifiable disease data to the CDC. The NBS Business Analyst is an integral part of the communicable disease investigation team. This position is responsible for all communication with electronic lab report (ELR) and electronic case report (eCR) data providers, hospitals, laboratories, clinics, the Health Information Exchange (HIE), internal IT staff, and others. The position is also responsible for researching electronic data issues and testing all electronic data received from submitters.  Essential Duties/Responsibilities:    Work through complex issues that include creating test scenarios, test cases, and test scripts mapped to workflow, and system design requirements.    Replicate, isolate, and identify a root cause while providing workarounds and testing, fixes, and patches in a staging or test environment.  Monitor system issues and provide feedback.  Research and resolve front-end/user and back-end/system problems by diagnosing the root cause, hypothesizing, and mapping out a possible solution, and testing the solution in the QA environment.    Resolve issues by engaging appropriate business/policy staff, software developers and/or vendor specialists.    Assist users in monitoring and analyzing their data via SQL querying and reporting.    Work closely with end users, project management, application developers, and others to understand features and create a robust, comprehensive test strategy to verify functionality.   Skill Matrix      Skill   Required /Desired   Amount   of Experience     Experience writing, refining, and analyzing SQL queries to answer questions and resolve issues   Required   7   Years     Extensive SQL skills   Required   7   Years     Experience creating test scenarios, test cases, and test scripts mapped to workflow, and system design requirements   Required   7   Years     Strong experience debugging applications   Required   7   Years     Curiosity with the ability to problem-solve in a creative but vigilant manner   Required   0       Critical thinking skills with a strong emphasis on accuracy, precision, and logical reasoning   Required   0       Verbal and written communication skills   Required   0       User-level experience with Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.   Required   0       Experience in public health or medical related industry   Highly desired   0           Recruiter Details:   Recruiter Name: Priya at gsksolutions dot com Contact Number:  Eight three two     Nine nine zero     Two four two seven   About GSK Solutions Inc:  GSK Solutions Inc is a leading information technology (IT) Services Company that specializes in providing complete consulting solutions and staff augmentation to its clients. title: Database Administrator 4
description: Job Title: Database Administrator 4 Location:  Lansing, MI (Hybrid 2 Days office) Duration: 12 Months   Top Skills & Years of Experience:  Years of experience: 12 or more years of experience in the field A bachelor's degree Azure Database Services SQL Data Modeling/structure Complex ETL Development Experience    The database environment includes:  Multiple SQL Server instances Multiple Collection Environments (Development, Quality Assurance/Testing, Pre-Release, and Production) Numerous SQL Reporting Services Servers 35+ collection databases 100+ analysis databases    This position is the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the CEPI SLDS data warehouse and requires considerable independent judgment directing and coordinating the appropriate data administration and management methods, practices, procedures and tools, to complete the required assignments. Expertise is required in Microsoft SQL Server database support, and professional knowledge on CEDS standard. This position is heavily involved with strategic and tactical information design, the analysis of business areas, security, and data modeling to meet data collection needs and the transition of ETL processes from on premise to cloud servers. Responsibility includes the identification, analysis, categorizing, synthesis, design, and productive use of business information. In addition, this position is responsible for enforcing/ensuring that the architectural frameworks are properly implemented and enforced, monitoring and upgrading the server infrastructure that supports the database environment.   Description of work: Top 3 skills needed: Complex ETL development experience. Azure Database services, SQL Data Modeling/structure    Designs, implements, and continuously expands/maintains data pipelines by performing extraction, transformation, and loading activities. Responsible for data preparation jobs, data analysis and data reporting. Performs technical troubleshooting, root cause analysis and provides technical expertise for ETL jobs. Collaborates with developers. Business and other team members to design and deliver correct high-quality data and to provide advice and support. Responsible for data analysis and database management. Involved in maintenance, enhancement, designing of data dictionaries, physical and logical database models, and performance tuning. Knowledge of the utilities and production tools used for data storage management to support the Application Team. Coordinates physical changes to computer databases; codes, tests, and implements physical database, applying knowledge of data base management system. Establishes physical database parameters. Uses structured query language (SQL) to define database objects using database definition language (DDL) and control access to database objects using data control language (DCL). Tests and corrects errors and refines changes to database. Enters SQL to create production data base. Uses database utility programs and 3rd party utilities to monitor database performance, such as distribution of records and amount of available memory. Directs programmers and analysts to make changes to data base management system. Reviews and corrects programs. Answers user questions. Confers with coworkers to determine impact of data base changes on other systems. Evaluates users' requests for new data elements and systems, incorporates them into the existing shared data environment, and provides technical assistance. Coordinates the use of data to ensure data integrity and control redundancy, loads databases, and reorganizes as needed. Performs data modeling and prototyping. Responsible for the development of ETLs. Performs logical and physical data modeling, designs relational database models, and creates physical data models from logical data models. Performs security recovery procedures. Executes the procedures necessary to save, retrieve, and recover databases from hardware and software failures within established procedures. Assists with determining, implementing, and enhancing standards on database security and with monitoring agency disaster recovery procedures and systems.

title: Sr. Electrical Engineer
description: Job Title:     Senior Electrical Engineer Description:  Seeking an Electrical Engineer who will work as a member of a dynamic team, in a fast-paced environment, solving challenging engineering problems. The qualified individual will require a combination of strong engineering and communication skills that will facilitate project management and engineering, troubleshooting, testing and condition assessments of equipment, construction supervision and procurement assistance. ***Must have Generator inspection and testing exp***  Could be steam or gas. Role and Responsibilities:   Promote safety by ensuring overall safe equipment condition and operation through enforcement of industry and company standards, policies and procedures  Perform system condition assessments to identify and document system or component deficiencies; generate and drive corrective actions  Supervise plant maintenance personnel in performing maintenance, troubleshooting, and performance testing of existing and new plant equipment to maximize equipment availability, reliability, and efficiency   Make technical decisions within area of competence with regard to decisions to accept as fit for purpose equipment, materials or components that are not in accordance with the original intent by virtue of wear and tear, defects, faults in manufacture or erection and where such decisions are made, to identify specific operating or maintenance restrictions that should be put in place in order to maintain an adequate level of risk  Prepare project analysis, budgets, schedules, and plans  Maintain quality control and safe work practices and while maintaining compliance within the project scope, schedule and budget  Prepare, implement, provide guidance, or assist in preparing and developing the engineering deliverables for electrical projects and major equipment such as power transformers, power circuit breakers, control house, and other low to high-voltage related materials including:    equipment and construction specifications  physical general arrangements  electrical one-line  all associated electrical calculations and studies  construction permit development  apply field mark-ups of project as-built drawings  analyze bids and recommend selection of equipment and/or constructor    Work closely with colleagues at the site to investigate and conduct root cause analysis of underperforming plant areas or systems and to identify options for the mitigation or elimination of these deficiencies  Support day-to-day operational activities, outage work, new projects and programs as required  Familiar with state and federal safety, regulatory compliance requirements, and construction codes   Support construction and equipment testing and commissioning  Coordinate and provide technical assistance for SCADA, substation/plant physical, and control projects in order to fully develop system integration of protection, control, and monitoring systems Qualifications:   B.S. (M.S. degree preferred) in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university with 7+ years of experience is required  Familiarity with the typical failure modes of the normal power plant materials, systems and plant component items and methods of non-destructive test used on generators, transformers, cables, insulation systems and major plant items  Familiarity with the principles of power plant auxiliary power distribution systems, properties of electrical materials, test procedures and precautions to be taken to ensure safety  Strong knowledge of AC/DC fundamentals, including understanding of three-phase power systems  Proficient understanding of the utility grid (power generation, transmission and distribution) systems  Knowledge of protection principles and practices for transmission lines, distribution feeders, and major plant and substation equipment  Ability to understand relaying one-lines and control schematics  Experience with plant and substation physical electrical, protection and control design schematics, SCADA systems, including station communications and station automation design  Knowledge of relevant codes and standards such as NEC, NESC, IEEE, NEMA and ANSI  Medium and high voltage experience with transformers, switchgear, breakers and power cables, generators, motors, MCC's, power panels, buss-work, or electric transmission is required   Prior relevant experience in utility plant and/or substation engineering  Design and project experience of overhead and underground medium and high voltage distribution/transmission cables, re-conductoring and asset replacement transmission projects in NYC or urban environment is desired  Experience in electrical system modeling, relay coordination, short circuit studies, setting microprocessor-based relays, field commissioning of electrical systems, NYISO interconnect studies is a plus  Team player who can work effectively in team environment  Strong written and oral communication skills  Strong organizational skills  High level of computer and internet competency  Proficiency with using Windows-based software programs

title: Jr. Performance Tester - Hybrid - Contract
description: Role: Jr. Performance Tester - Preferring local resourcesLocation: 4 IRVING PLACE, NY- hybrid roleDuration: 12+ monthsRate: $market/hrInterview Process : Video (Teams) InterviewHybrid Assignment Details Project DescriptionThe IT Business Systems Delivery (BSD) Customer Engagement Product Delivery team supports, manages and implements a portfolio of IT system capital initiatives with our Customer Operations, Energy Management, Steam and Customer Energy Solution (CES) business partners. This IT team supports each initiative from conception to implementation and provides the necessary IT support required to either enhance existing systems, create or enhance interfaces and or design, develop, test and implement new applications. The Customer Engagement Capital Product Delivery Team is looking for a Performance Tester with strong communications skills, to work within existing IT teams to help foster relationships, facilitate and coordinate standard project operations and support and drive excellence. Role & ResponsibilitiesPerformance Testing Planning and Strategy: Collaborate with stakeholders to define performance testing objectives and requirements. Develop a comprehensive performance testing strategy and plan. Performance Test Design Design and create performance test scenarios based on application requirements and usage patterns. Determine the appropriate load levels, concurrency, and transaction volumes for different test scenarios. Develop test scripts and define workload models for performance tests. Test Environment Setup Configure and set up the performance testing environment to accurately simulate production conditions. Ensure hardware, software, network configurations, and other resources meet the performance testing requirements. Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams including developers, QA engineers, system administrators, and project managers to ensure a holistic approach to performance testing. Effectively communicate performance test plans, progress, issues, and results to stakeholders. Tools and Technologies: Utilize appropriate performance testing tools and technologies (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner, Gatling) to conduct tests effectively. Performance Tuning and Optimization: Provide recommendations for performance improvements based on test results and analysis. Collaborate with development teams to optimize code and system performance. Security and Compliance: Ensure that performance testing activities comply with security and privacy standards. Collaborate with security teams to identify and report any security vulnerabilities discovered during performance testing. Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of performance testing processes, test scenarios, test scripts, and results for future reference and knowledge sharing. title: Senior Analog/RF IC Design Engineer
description: Title:    Senior Analog/RF IC Design Engineer    Location:          Hillsboro, OR (hybrid)         Duration: FTE          No. of openings: 3     **             Candidates must be current US residents with valid work authorization. **             Our client, a leader in the test-and-measurement, wireless communications, and cyber-security industries, has an immediate need for a    highly motivated Senior Analog/RF CMOS/BiCMOS Design Engineer to join their team in designing the next generation data convertors for their world class test equipment. This is a small team environment in a great location that is very collaborative with close personal interactions. The selected individual will work with a highly qualified team of engineers, located both locally and abroad.      Your Role          As part of this team, you will have an opportunity to work on many different modules within their devices and to work with the true leaders in the design of world class data convertors. Your tasks will cover the entire spectrum of mixed signal development starting from conceptual work, through the design, layout, and characterization of the devices. Your designs will          integrate large high frequency (> 30 GHz) blocks along with complex digital blocks to create our custom System on Chip (SoC) solutions that are exclusively used in the test equipment.             This is what you need to be selected:           MS degree in electrical engineering, with 5+ years of experience in IC Design.    Thorough understanding of detailed analog circuit design and the ability to design independently various functional blocks.      In-depth understanding of BiCMOS and CMOS process technologies.            Knowledge in the design and operation of the following          analog blocks : low noise high linearity amplifiers and mixers, VCOs, filters, line drivers, power amplifiers, mixed analog / custom digital circuits, basic analog building blocks (op amps, comparators, current sources, current mirrors, voltage references).            Good knowledge of RF engineering, specifically transmission lines theory, matching, RF device models.           Ability to communicate effectively with both internal and external customers.    Ability to travel occasionally to European and U.S. locations.    Work effectively in a group setting (share expertise, provide and receive feedback, communicate technical issues, work in a team environment to resolve technical issues).             Desirable qualifications - The more of these that you have, the better fit within the team:    Good knowledge of the principles of high-speed data converters.    Experience with high-speed (>        30 GHz) CML logic design.      Understanding of simulation models, design rules, and verification procedures (DRC/LVS/ERC).           Experience with design details such as: minimizing device mismatch, noise, signal coupling, ESD, circuit stability.           Experience designing analog integrated circuits for a complex mixed signal SoCs from creation into production.           Experience with transistor level design tools (Cadence Analog Artist, Explorer), layout tools (Cadence Virtuoso).           Experience with system level design tools (e.g. Matlab, Verilog-AMS, etc.).    Experience designing in a mixed signal environment.            Everest Consultants is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state, or federal civil rights laws. #IND

title: Enterprise Systems Engineer
description: We are looking for an Enterprise Systems Engineer, under the leadership of the Senior Manager of Enterprise Infrastructure, who is responsible for multiple functional areas. This position serves as an escalation point for complex, enterprise level issues and is responsible for delivering solutions and support services for multiple systems. This includes on-premises and Azure-based services, hyperconverged infrastructure hardware, VMware hypervisor and Windows server technologies, Active Directory, authentication integrations, and interoperability between various business technologies. The Enterprise Systems Engineer role is to ensure the stability and integrity of critical firm platforms. The individual will participate in the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and integration of any number of server and infrastructure-oriented platforms and services. The qualified individual should be able to manage and support data center services according to best practices and company policy that meet business continuity requirements and administrative needs. They must also be able to work both in a cooperative team environment as well as individually to oversee the design, implementation, and support of infrastructure systems. A strong degree of creative, "out of the box" thinking, flexibility to grow with technology changes at the firm, attention to detail, and self-motivation are required. The candidate must also possess strong communication skills to build inter-department trust and leadership ability to accomplish company-wide objectives. Additionally, the ability to define and document complex designs and system topology standards is mandatory.Job Responsibilities Participate with the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and integration of any number of server and infrastructure-oriented platforms and services. Manage and support data center services according to best practices and company policy that meet business continuity requirements and administrative needs. The ability to work both in a cooperative team environment as well as individually to oversee the design, implementation, and support of infrastructure systems. Strong degree of creative, "out of the box" thinking, flexibility to expand oneself outside of the job description, attention to detail, and self-motivation are required. Strong communication skills to broker inter-department engagements and leadership ability to accomplish company-wide objectives. The ability to define and document complex designs and system topology standards is mandatory. Promptly respond and act as the final escalation point for complex technical issues; independently identify, research, and resolve complex technical problems. Document incidents and communicate appropriately regarding root cause, resolution, and preventative measures. Serve as an occasional project-based lead to other staff, under the guidance of the Senior Manager of Enterprise Infrastructure. Plans, analyzes, and implements complex technology; defines requirements for creative, logical, and effective systems; defines and documents complex designs and architecture standards; documents and makes recommendations to management, including capacity planning. Participates in/on a variety of meetings and/or committees, including the Architecture Review Board, as needed. May be called upon to present architecture designs to the ARB. Initiate and analyze changes in a robust change control methodology. Responsible for adhering to change control process for servers and systems throughout the enterprise. Participate in after-hours escalations and maintenance tasks, as needed. Occasional travel may be required. Perform special assignments and other duties as assigned by management.Technical Skills Microsoft Azure tenant and resource management Group Policy design and administration Experience deploying solutions in public cloud platforms. Multi-factor authentication (DUO) Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) and other SAML/single sign-on integrations Active Directory domain/forest trust implementation Quest AD management platforms and utilities, including Quest Migration Manager for AD and QMM for Exchange Familiarity with load balancing technologies (preferably F5) Ability to design, install, configure, and support Microsoft Active Directory based identity management and systems integrations. Extensive experience operating and managing Microsoft Windows server platforms. An understanding of physical and virtual network topologies, both on-premises and Azure cloud based. Experience with managing server virtualization platforms.Education Requirements Bachelor's degree from accredited college or university strongly preferred or minimum eight (8) to ten (10) years  experience in medium to large environment. Five (5) or more years of experience in enterprise environments and data center infrastructure. Role related training and/or certifications.

title: Graph DBA
description: Remote Until End of Year  Day-to-day:  Looking for DBA experience, preferably Tigergraph, need to know basic Tigergraph commands, if not Tigergraph, target Cassandra or Neo4j or other graph database and we can potentially open up from there. Performance tuning, backups, installations, scaling the infrastructure, database configurations. Experience in Python and Powershell/shell scripting. Need knowledge of the cloud. Currently in Google Cloud Platform but will be moving to Azure. Open to AWS. Candidates should have experience in multiple major cloud platforms. If someone has Tigergraph we can forego that and just consider 1 cloud platform. Just knowledge of hosting on VMs in the cloud, dics running on the cloud, cloud compute and storage. Do not need particular services. Databases themselves are not hosted on the cloud. Team is also responsible for managing the data APIs in Java--APIs are already built but would like experience in managing APIs and containerization (nice to have) Ansible and Terraform also nice to have Expects someone with strong technical aptitude to pick things up quickly.  Should expect basic database knowledge. Distinctions between databases, what use cases they serve, NoSQL, Relational Databases, Document Databases, GraphQL--what are the best use cases for each based on capabilities/restrictions.    Must Have:  Database administration experience (Tigergraph, Net4j or other Graph database top priority, followed by Cassandra) Performance tuning, database configuration and scalability, backup and recovery Python scripting + other shell scripting (Powershell, Bash, Perl, etc) Cloud experience (2/3 Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform)--perspective of compute     Nice to Have:  Java API experience Containerization Ansible Terraform  Notes    Hands-on Tigergraph or any other graph DB experience  Experience in configuration management tools like Ansible Experience in shell scripting Experience with Google Cloud Platform/Azure cloud Familiar with Java Springboot framework and Python Experience with Kubernetes & docker containers Take ownership and drive technical conversations between teams. Cassandra DB admin experience Preferred experience in banking domain as a DB admin   Regards Sachin Agarwal

Monday & Tuesday W2 position; 12 months with possibility of extension  Position description: The Project Manager provides oversight, leadership, accountability, and portfolio management functions for a large-size, complex portfolio of projects.   The Project Manager will help manage and maintain the client s Enterprise IT Investment Management portfolio and the annual Call for Projects program. Top skills: 5+ years of documented experience in successfully managing a program or portfolio for complex projects (including multiple stakeholders, staff, vendors, data conversions, and multiple technologies). 3+ years of documented experience performing Project Management, Quality Management, or other critical functions within complex Information Technology projects (preferably with budgets greater than $3,000,000 and multi-phase, multiyear implementations). Professional certification in Project Management, such as Project Management Professional (PMP) certification from the Project Management Institute. Responsibilities: Develop and manage metrics for the Portfolio.  The Portfolio of projects is highly visible, including public-facing and revenue-generating functions for the client.  Roles performed require regular interaction with the agency and executive staff. Manages Portfolio of projects' execution to ensure conformity to established budgets, timelines, and scope. Manage the timeline and documentation pertaining to the Investment Management process, including the Call for Projects process, working with the governance. Perform long-term release planning based on organizational direction, regularly interact with the project management teams for the status of budget, quality and schedule, escalate issues and risks as needed to executives and exercise project quality control activities to ensure project scope expectations are met. Coordinates and controls the end-to-end process of capturing all key project artifacts, including, but not limited to, business cases, project charters, baselined project schedules, project management plans, change requests, status reports, and lessons learned. It may require consistently utilizing the SUITE methodology and Project Portfolio Management (PPM) tool. Raise identified issues and risks to the appropriate senior management level, including the Project Management Office (PMO), for action, including a description of the issue, comprehensive analysis of options, and recommendation for remediation. Work with the stakeholders, including the PMO, to facilitate project governance effectiveness through weekly status reporting, project/portfolio data, regular governance meetings, etc. Required knowledge, skills, and abilities: Documented experience in successfully managing Information Technology (IT) projects or programs (full project life cycle) whose budget was greater than $3,000,000 (excluding hardware/software costs) and whose timeline was greater than 3 years. 5 years of recent experience in managing IT projects or programs (preferably within a government environment) Desired knowledge, skills, and abilities: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated leadership ability in complex projects involving multiple vendors and in-house resources within all levels of an organization. Knowledge and understanding of the Information Systems Audit and Control Association s (ISACA) Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI). Knowledge and understanding of the IT Governance Framework, COBIT. Knowledge and understanding of Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL). Interested? description: Role-: Embedded Software Developer - Functional Safety  Location: Allen Park, MI Exp- 7+ years Duration: Fulltime / C2C Automotive domain   The Mandatory Requirements:   1. Analyze the feature technical safety requirement and develop software safety requirements. 2. Work with software architecture engineers to allocate the software safety requirement to the architecture. 3. Develop the MATLAB/Simulink Models as per the software safety requirements to meet ASIL D  4. Perform software unit verification in MIL/SIL environment based on software safety requirements. 5. Support feature owner and application team to build and maintain common project-specific calibrations. 6. Develop work products as per ISO 26262 Chapter 6 and collect required test evidence to build software safety cases. 7. Support system engineer and HW engineer to create hardware software interface. 8. Perform the Software FTA and DFMEA on the software level. 9. Support field issue resolution and root-cause analysis. 10. Contribute to process improvement to achieve ASPICE compliance.   The Minimum Requirements:     Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field.     3+ years' experience in Software development per ISO26262.  2+ years' experience in software development and code generation using Matlab, Simulink/Targetlink.   Thanks, Sanjay Kumar

title: Integration Engineer
description: Stefanini Group is hiring! Stefanini is looking for Sr. Integration Engineer in San Francisco, CA. (Hybrid role)W2 Candidates only! For quick Apply, please reach out to Anshu Singhal - call: / Email:    Responsibilities:Primary responsibility of this role is to support the Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) product which includes developing application integrations, supporting all phases of the System Development Lifecycle (SDLC), facilitating customer on-boarding, migrating integration functionality from Mulesoft to ACE, and assisting with product enhancements and production support. This opportunity will allow you to work cross-functionally with Architects, Developers/Engineers, Business Analysts, and Product Managers across multiple teams in a rapidly evolving environment. To be successful in this role, you must be an organized, self-starter with stellar collaboration and communication skills, who can work independently building relationships and driving technical solutions from inception to completion. This position requires the candidate to be technically savvy and have a proven ability to work well in a highly dynamic environment while maintaining strong relationships with our customers and partners.Required Experience:3+ years of experience in designing and developing complex service bus integrations and APIs that require the participation and collaboration of cross-functional entities using the MuleSoft Anypoint and IBM IIB/ACE platformsFamiliarity with IBM MQ and similar messaging technologies Minimum 2 years of experience with leading application server platforms; and hands on experience in using relational DBMS, including Oracle and/or Amazon RDSMinimum 2 years of experience providing production support with demonstrated customer service prowess Prior experience analyzing business requirements and building Use Cases and translating business requirements to clear technical specifications Demonstrated ability to design/develop systems for heterogeneous security technologies Proven experience in working collaboratively, coordinating among cross-functional teams and the ability to work effectively with organizational differences and prioritiesExcellent communication (oral and written) and analytical skills; strong and demonstrated interpersonal skills to include influence, collaboration, accountability, and critical thinkingProven desire to continuously learn new technologiesClear understanding of and experience with team development best practices to include peer reviews processes and version control systemsAbility to work effectively both independently and in a team environmentJudgement to escalate risk-based decisions appropriately Experience working in AWS environmentPreferred Skills: Experience with Mulesoft Anypoint 4.0 and higher Experience with RAMLExperience with MQ 8 and 9 and higher Experience with Web services Experience with Java, .NET, Rest/SOAP, ESQL Experience with ODBC/JDBC Experience with service registry and API service gateway implementationsExperience with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) including micro/mini-service architecturesExperience with automating deployments and deploying into all levels of environmentsExperience with Cloud computing environments Experience with ESB performance monitoring and troubleshooting ESB performance issuesFamiliar with Agile and Scrum methodologies*nix scripting skillsGood understanding of functional/nonfunctional testing concepts, and experience with code analysis tools a plusExperience with collaboration tools such as Subversion, JIRA, ALM, Confluence, MS TeamsDemonstrated technical expertise across a variety of technology platforms and solutions Education:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field or equivalent work experience ***Listed salary ranges may vary based on experience, qualifications, and local market. Also, some positions may include bonuses or other incentives***  Stefanini takes pride in hiring top talent and developing relationships with our future employees. Our talent acquisition teams will never make an offer of employment without having a phone conversation with you. Those face-to-face conversations will involve a description of the job for which you have applied. We also speak with you about the process including interviews and job offers.  About Stefanini Group: The Stefanini Group is a global provider of offshore, onshore and near shore outsourcing, IT digital consulting, systems integration, application, and strategic staffing services to Fortune 1000 enterprises around the world. Our presence is in countries like the Americas, Europe, Africa, and Asia, and more than four hundred clients across a broad spectrum of markets, including financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical services, technology, public sector, and utilities. Stefanini is a CMM level 5, IT consulting company with a global presence. We are CMM Level 5 company.

title: Cloud Security Senior Manager (Remote)
description: Stefanini Group is hiring! Exciting opportunity awaits, let us help you get started! Click Apply Now or you may call:  / email:  for faster processing! Open to W2 candidates!   Job Title:  Cloud Security Senior Manager    Work Hours:  First Shift (Remote) working mainly EST hours 8-5   Work Location:  REMOTE (but please EST, CST or MST only)   We are seeking an Cloud Security Senior Manager for a remote position with a key client of ours in North America. A career in Cloud and Infrastructure Operations, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to focus on developing and supporting our global internal infrastructure operations and security technologies. Using industry vendors such as Microsoft, Amazon, Google, and other cloud platforms, you will design and implement innovative services for our network of firms. You'll be at the forefront of helping Internal Firm Services around the globe adopt innovative technology solutions that optimize business processes or enable scalable technology. Our team helps Internal Firm Services transform their network architecture and infrastructure to fundamentally change the role of Information Technology from a custodial asset to an orchestrator of business services. As part of the team, you'll focus on the infrastructure operations of data centers, including the design and implementation of network architecture and information storage to optimize innovation and program delivery for our Internal Firm Services.    Responsibilities  As a Cloud Security Senior Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers with extensive consulting and industry experience, helping our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:Transitioning technology from a local focus to a central technology service organization.Select, test and implement infrastructure/security products, and technologies.Develop strategies to solve complex technical challenges for our stakeholders.Design, build, and deploy cloud infrastructure using automation tools such as Terraform, Packet, Vault, etc.Design and build security technology solutions aligned to a global central service environment using scripting languages such as JSON, Bash, Shell, Python, Java, etc.Implement Cloud/IT Security development strategies, projects, and transition to operations.Develop documentation for infrastructure/security solutions and processes.Identify areas of Cloud/IT security improvements and drive respective work stream activities.Provide Cloud, Infrastructure, and Security-related training to team members as required.Additional responsibilities will be added according to the Firm's alignment to current and future initiatives. Preferred Knowledge/Skills:7+ years of experience in Cloud and or Information Security field.3+ years of experience in leading large-scale Infrastructure and or Information Security projects.Cloud System Architecture Experience: Load Balancing, Auto-Scaling, Security Groups, Key Management.Designing and building security technology solutions aligned to a global central service environment.Experience in leading technology transitions from locally focused to centralized technology service organization.Understanding of RESTful Web Service and APIs, as well to design/develop automation flows.Experience with Linux and Windows Operating Systems administration.Experience with Application Builds and Integrations.IT and Security management best practice (ITIL, COBIT, ISO standards).Technical Root Cause Analysis.Consulting business experience in large consulting firms.Basic DevOps skills (Nice to Have but not required).   Desired Certifications / Skills:ISC2 CCSP Certified Cloud Security Professional.ITIL Certification(s).Cloud computing certifications such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services.Development Operations Tool Experience (Jenkins, Github, VSTS, Gitlab, TravisCI).Container Experience: Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm.Configuration Management Experience (Preferably Ansible and/or Puppet).

title: Cloud Delivery Engineer/Architect (Remote)
description: DPP is seeking a Cloud Delivery Engineer/Architect for a fully remote opportunity with our client in Lansing, Michigan. The client is seeking two engineers for this role. Work arrangement: Remote W2 position; 12 months with possibility of extensionPosition description: The Cloud Architect / Engineer will be involved in the design, implementation and management of technology-based business solutions based on Cloud Service models to improve our clients  delivery approach. Focus on Cloud engineering and deployment. Will wear multiple hats assisting the client s Cloud Architects and team to comprehend objectives, generate solutions, POC the solution, generate recommendations, then implement the decisions. This position will assist with the build out of a multi-cloud environment such as the public, private, and hybrid clouds for successful delivery of cloud products. This professional draws on solid knowledge of the client s cloud architecture and platform when developing and deploying dynamic cloud solutions. Top skills: Solid knowledge of concepts of designing and developing dynamic Cloud solutions and moving parts involved in continuous integration and delivery. Solid understanding and skill DevOps, web services and application programming interfaces (APIs). Experience with Tooling and Automation to enable seamless automation of infrastructure provisioning and configuration. Clear and concise written and verbal communication is crucial to success and productivity in this role.Responsibilities:Core Competencies Design and deliver dynamically scalable, available, fault-tolerant, reliable, and secure cloud solutions on Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform. Strong understanding of infrastructure as code (IaC). Chaos engineering experience. Strong understanding of virtual networks and general network management functions. Solid knowledge of concepts of designing and developing dynamic cloud solutions. Solid knowledge of concepts and moving parts involved in continuous integration and delivery. Expert guidance to development teams regarding infrastructure. Interpret and provide solutions on complex technologies/architectures. Cloud Formation / automation / Ansible / PowerShell / DSC / Comparable Linux scripting. Experience equivalent to site reliability engineering, DevOps, and/or DevSecOps Other skills: Containerization, Linux, Database skills, security and recovery, web services and applications programming interfaces (APIs) Core Tasks Provide strategic and support representing design services and the client s cloud strategy as a subject matter expert. Identify and prioritize critical business functions in collaboration with organizational stakeholders. Build and maintain relationships across organizational teams. Consult with vendor product specialists/sales, independent research organizations, on-site support engineers and fellow architects and administrators on best-fit technologies to ensure compliance to department policies & standards and technology roadmap. Coordinate with enterprise architecture team for technology validation or suggestions for alternative solutions. If necessary, initiate solution assessments, infrastructure service. Infrastructure provisioning and configuration. Document and knowledge transfer; document pipeline architecture, design decisions, and setup instructions for future reference and onboarding of new team members. Conduct knowledge transfer sessions and provide training to relevant stakeholders to ensure a smooth transition and adoption of the infrastructure deployment pipeline. Requests, and any applicable required documentation to implement new technology. Advocate the use of emerging cyber security best practices, technologies, developing standards and procedures, promoting the usage of automated tools, developing strategies, and aligning practices with enterprise strategic initiatives. Lead the development of technical artifacts including requirements traceability matrix (RTM), detailed technical design, security architecture plan, services description document, etc. Produce architectural framework documents (i.e., white papers, guidance documents, best practices, technical reports, etc.). Leverage broad-based understanding of technology areas and end-to-end knowledge of current installations to craft architectural solutions or standards that can be applied across the enterprise. Define and build hypothesis around steady state behavior. Run experiments around real world events to define potential impact or estimate frequency. Tooling and automation: evaluate and select appropriate tools and technologies to support the infrastructure deployment pipeline. Implement and configure the chosen tools to enable seamless automation of infrastructure provisioning and configuration. Integrate pipelines with existing continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) systems and other relevant tools. Enable self-service capabilities for infrastructure provisioning and promote collaboration among development and operations teams. Provide support and subject matter expertise with respect to adherence to best practice security framework controls and other industry-based regulatory compliance requirements (e.g., NIST 800-37, 800-53, 800-171, 800-204, 800-207, CIS, PCI, IRS-Pub 1075, CJIS, and related). Assist with cloud infrastructure design and develop detailed architecture models for the client to host test, development, and production environments. Communicate complex technical concepts to individuals of various technical ability. Provide performance analysis & troubleshooting. Design and test large-scale workload and data migrations. Provide direct support to technical and non-technical entities to define requirements and deliver solutions to meet organizational needs including new environment deployment, upgrades, performance tuning, testing and disaster recovery. Integrate cloud services with on-premises technologies from Microsoft, Dell, EMC, HP, Nutanix, Cohesity, Pure Storage, VMware, Cisco, and Rubric. Required knowledge, skills, and abilities: 3+ years of experience as a Cloud Delivery Engineer / Architect Solid knowledge of concepts of designing and developing dynamic Cloud solutions and moving parts involved in continuous integration and delivery. Experience with Tooling and Automation to enable seamless automation of infrastructure provisioning and configuration. Pipeline Design and Architecture to improve development flow and delivery. Solid understanding and skill with DevOps, web services and application programming interfaces (APIs). Experience with Servers, Infrastructure, Platform Sizing, Infrastructure Cost Reduction. Highly desired KSAs: Create, maintain, and troubleshooting skills for cloud infrastructure Cloud security and compliance experience Desired certifications: Google - Professional Cloud Architect AWS - Solution Architect Professional Azure - MCSE: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure Interested? Learn more:Click the apply button or contact our recruiter William at  to learn more about this position (#23-00743). DPP offers a range of compensation and benefits packages to our employees and their eligible dependents. Call today to learn more about working with DPP. Authorized US Worker - s and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time. EOE/AA/V/D
