title: Biomedical Equipment Technician
description: Stefanini Group is hiring! Stefanini is looking for Biomedical Equipment Technician for Largo, FL Location For quick Apply, please reach out to Shubham Singh - call: / email:    Work Hours: M-F (40 hours)  Work Location: Largo, FL Shift: 2nd Shift (2:45 PM to 11:15 PM)   Job Description: The Largo facility is dedicated to servicing peritoneal dialysis machines and infusion pump devices. Biomedical Equipment Technicians contribute to our mission of saving and sustaining lives by performing electronic troubleshooting to determine root failure and perform preventative maintenance evaluations. Biomedical Equipment Technicians are hands-on and enjoy solving technical problems, applying attention to detail, working autonomously, variation in their work, and documenting findings.  Our ideal and target candidate are those with a relevant degree in Biomedical Engineering Technology, Engineering, or the Electronics field. Candidates without a relevant degree, but who have a Biomedical Equipment Technician certificate (i.e., BMET) with previous related service and troubleshooting experience are also ideal. Previous field service experience is highly preferred but is not required.Those individuals without a degree or certification will be considered if they have the required level of experience.  Adheres to all environmental, health and safety SOP's, equipment, policies and procedures, including any department specific requirements.Maintains a mindset that all accidents can be prevented and works pro-actively to achieve zero harm in the workplace.Follows defined Quality Management Systems, all applicable procedures, reviews maintenance records, and completes all documentation as required.Maintains a continuous flow of the servicing line and works independently and as a part of a team to achieve process yield results.Examines, tests, repairs and performs troubleshooting of medical devices to assignable cause using instruments such as digital multimeters, oscilloscopes, hipot tester, pressure gauges.Applies technical knowledge to interpret information, test for accuracy, discern patterns in order to determine a root cause.Writes clear and concise technical evaluation summaries resulting from troubleshooting analysis.May rotate into the repair and test areas as needed.May perform inspection duties as required per required procedures.May train employees on an as needed basis.Performs other duties as assigned.  Job Requirement: Associate degree in Biomedical Engineering Technology, Engineering or in Electronics field. OR equivalent technical (i.e., BMET) or electrical certification and 1+ years of experience in troubleshooting and analyzing electro-mechanical devices required. OR High School diploma or GED required; and 3+ or more years of experience in troubleshooting and analyzing electro-mechanical devices is required.Medical device experience or other regulated industry preferred.Previous field service technician experience is highly preferred.   To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily:Good verbal and written communication skills and ability to follow work instructions is required.Ability to work well together and independently and as a part of a team with minimal supervision.Basic math skills required.Proficient computer skills required to enter data, navigate, and routinely toggle between various applications, such as Microsoft Office Suite, and company software programs in the area of expertise are required.Ability to work independently to effectively determine root cause of failure.Ability to perform basic statistical analysis from device history logs, read diagrams and drawings and make repair recommendations.Ability to write clear and concise reports to sufficiently capture and defend evaluation findings.Must be able to wear applicable personal protective equipment (PPE) in designated areas as required including safety glasses at all times.Ability to sit and or stand for long periods of time with frequent walking, stooping, reaching, grasping and using fine & gross motor manipulation.Must be able to lift up to 30lbs on a routine basis and occasionally up to 41lbs.Ability to work overtime as needed.     ***Listed salary ranges may vary based on experience, qualifications, and local market. Also, some positions may include bonuses or other incentives***   Stefanini takes pride in hiring top talent and developing relationships with our future employees. Our talent acquisition teams will never make an offer of employment without having a phone conversation with you. Those face-to-face conversations will involve a description of the job for which you have applied. We also speak with you about the process including interviews and job offers. Our presence is in countries like the Americas, Europe, Africa, and Asia, and more than four hundred clients across a broad spectrum of markets, including financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical services, technology, public sector, and utilities. Ability to work in a large team environment and communicate effectively with developers and other supporting team like database admins, infrastructure, and network teams. Should have Strong leadership, analytical skills, and ability to work in team in diverse/ multiple stakeholder environment.       Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment. Nice to have. title: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Business Analyst/Scrum Master
description: Position Summary: IT Business Analyst/Scrum Master who is well-versed in full life-cycle software development, specifically following Agile methodologies. This position is client facing and will encompass the management of projects spanning new development, operations, and maintenance (O&M), and end-of-life phases. As the Business Analyst/Scrum Master, you will provide leadership for project tasks and will bear the responsibility of overseeing all project deliverables while diligently conducting various sprint ceremonies. These ceremonies include daily scrum meetings, sprint pre-planning, planning sessions, retrospectives, and reviews/demonstrations. This role on the program necessitates thorough story analysis, continuous management of User Stories and other backlog items, and the ability to provide prompt responses to ad hoc inquiries. Furthermore, you will offer clear guidance and direction to development and support teams concerning user stories and associated functionalities. Work is performed remotely, but if our federal client changes this policy our resource must be flexible to working on-site as needed in Woodlawn, MD. ship or US Permanent residence () is required. Only local W2 candidates will be considered (No 3rd party Corp to Corp is permitted).Responsibilities: Schedule and facilitate all Agile ceremonies, technical meetings, client meetings. Follow through with team members on task and board updates. Remove impediments that hinder the team's progress and escalate issues when necessary. Interface with project owners and business product owners, oversee execution of scope of work; Ensure deliverables meet project scope and project owner expectations and provide guidance and direction to team. Collaborate with product owners, business stakeholders, and other teams to ensure alignment on priorities, expectations, and deliverables. Foster a positive and open team environment, encouraging open communication, active listening, and constructive feedback. Mentor team members, product owners, and stakeholders in Agile methodologies, roles, and responsibilities. Track and report key Agile metrics, such as velocity, burn-down charts, and cycle time, to monitor the team's performance and identify areas for improvement. Communicate the team's progress, accomplishments, and challenges to stakeholders in a transparent and timely manner. Use data-driven insights to guide decision-making and support the team in setting realistic goals. Mediate conflicts within the team and foster a respectful and collaborative environment for resolving differences; Promote constructive problem-solving and ensure that conflicts are addressed in a timely and professional manner. Maintain documentation regarding various projects, processes and operations. Support the agency s Citizen Developer Community. Support the cross-agency RPA Community of Practice (CoP) by collaborating with agencies on best practices, etc. Responsible for evaluating HHS/CMS business processes, identifying areas for improvement, documenting requirements, and developing and implementing Automated solutions.  Invest in current processes to identify improvement opportunities and obtain consensus on direction after reviewing alternative solutions with stakeholders.Required: ship or US Permanent Residence (); must have ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust clearance. Local to Baltimore/Washington, D.C. metro area, with ability to attend occasional on-site meetings if required. 6-8 years of experience serving as a Scrum Master on software development projects.  Must have experience as a Business Analyst or Scrum Master on at least one RPA project. (Project experience utilizing UIPath is strongly desired)   Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience. Certified Scrum Master (CSM), PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), Certified Agile Project Manager (CAPM), Professional Scrum Master (PSM), Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) or similar Agile certifications. Deep understanding of Agile methodologies; proven experience as a Scrum Master for software development projects. Ability to lead and inspire teams, fostering a collaborative and empowered environment. Proficiency in using agile tools and software for tracking and reporting (e.g., JIRA, Trello, ServiceNow, etc.). Strong communication skills; ability to communicate and collaborate with cross-functional groups - both technical and non-technical. A commitment to continuous learning and staying up to date with industry trends and best practices. Excellent communication (verbal and written), facilitation, and interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving abilities and decision-making capabilities, and the capacity to adapt to changing circumstances. Sound business ethics, including the protection of proprietary and confidential information. Ability to work with all levels of internal staff, federal agency clients, as well as outside clients and vendors. Team player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Demonstrated outstanding level of professionalism in providing client support, including ability to exercise good judgment, discretion, tact, and diplomacy. Preferred: Experience in a dual-hatted role as a Business Analyst/Scrum Master on a UIPath Robotic Process Automation (RPA) project for a Federal Government agency. US Department of Health Human Resources experience About: ExpediteInfoTech, Inc. (EIT) is an SBA 8(a) certified small business. Headquartered in Rockville, MD since 2012, EIT has provided specialized technical, cybersecurity, IT, and financial advisory solutions to the Federal, State and County governments. Our clients include the US Department of Education, US Department of Transportation, US Department of Justice, US Department of Health & Human Services, Montgomery County government, Prince George's County Government, the governments of the State of Maryland and the District of Columbia. EIT is appraised at level 3 for CMMI Services & CMMI Development, as well as ISO 9001:2015, ISO 20000-1:2018 and ISO 27001:2013.EIT offers a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision and prescription drug coverage, paid time off, federal holidays, matching 401K plan, and tuition/professional development reimbursement benefits.EIT is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Systems Engineer
description: Looking for an exciting, ever-changing job that involves the newest transportation technology, then we are looking for you!   Stefanini Group is looking for a Lead Systems Design Engineer & System Architect for a globally recognized automotive company based in Greensboro, NC!   Open to C2C candidates   For interested applicants, click the apply button or you may reach out to Gaurav Choudhary at  or  for faster processing. Thank you.       Role Description The Systems Engineering team is at the heart of the electromobility and digital transformation within automotive industry. We develop new systems, architectures, and concepts with focus on electrical and electronics systems.   As a Lead Systems Design Engineer & System Architect you will contribute to the development of the architectural roadmap for systems and functions. You will work with stakeholders from various technology teams, component owners, internal and external solution providers, and product management to identify design concepts that will best meet our customer's needs.   You will lead the solution development activities in complex product development projects, review design solutions and secure approvals from the relevant internal and external stakeholders, including regulatory forums. An integral part of the job is to write technical reports and cross functional specifications and communicate with stakeholders and developers. You describe the solutions by breaking down pre-requisites and requirements and elaborate how they will affect the electrical system. You will propose system design concepts through embedded software specifications, electrical schematics and block diagrams for vehicle functions related to area of responsibility.   Main ResponsibilitiesLead and support development of technical concepts on subsystem/component level with global and cross functional alignmentTake an active system architecture lead role in the exchange with other functions and departments in order to deliver robust engineering solutions.Perform the work needed to develop and anchor system evolution roadmaps for various electrical architecture.Writes Technical reports and cross functional specifications - breaking down pre-requisites and requirements describing how they will affect the electrical system and propose system design concepts to fulfil them.Develops embedded software specifications, electrical schematics and block diagrams for vehicle functions related to area of responsibility.Participates in quality tool screening, plans and executes the agreed quality tasks.Coordinate activities with other departments, external and internal customers and vendors as necessary to ensure the desired deliverables.   Who are you? To be successful in this role you need to be a team player and have an analytic mindset of a true problem solver. You love to understand how things work and dedicate yourself to proposing the best system solutions to fulfill customer needs. You are open-minded and thrive in a dynamic environment. You are also on the constant lookout to find ways to improve yourself and the product you are working on.   Requested skills and experience:BSEE/BSME or MSEE/MSME and 10+ years of experience in commercial vehicle or automotive product development, or similar experienceExcellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written.Detailed knowledge about Electronic Hardware / Software & Supporting Infrastructure Architecture Design & Overall DevelopmentKnowledge of different automotive communication protocols, standards & toolsKnowledge of tools related to software development, diagnostics & production / aftermarket systems.Experienced in working in an environment of global / local organization with cross functional interaction.Well-versed in Agile way of working & SAFe as well as good understanding of project operations.Knowledge in Quality Management (QMS), SFMEA, Product Quality Assurance and Quality tools   Merit Commercial vehicle or Automotive experience, Embedded Systems, CAN, LIN, ISO 26262, J1939, AUTOSAR, Systems Engineering.     ***Listed salary ranges may vary based on experience, qualifications, and local market. title: IT Helpdesk Specialist
description: Our Client, an award winning, multi-practice law firm, is seeking for an IT Helpdesk Specialist.Position Type: Full-Time/Direct-HireLocation: Fort Lauderdale, FLSchedule: Fully OnsiteJob Summary:We are looking for technically skilled candidates with good problem-solving ability to join our IT Support Team.The duties of this role include being a reference point for all IT-related queries at the user level, responding to user needs in a timely manner, and ensuring the optimal running of all systems, among other technical duties.Job Duties:* The Support Specialist includes all aspects of help desk support and end user technical assistance.* They must address a wide variety of user issues, including software problems, hardware failures, and network issues.* When a user submits a ticket or otherwise contacts the help desk, IT Tech Support tracks the ticket/issue and works to identify the problem using standard practices and their own experience.* Once the problem has been identified, they must address it. description: Our Client, an world's largest conveyorized car wash equipment manufacturer is seeking for an Sr Cost Accountant.Position Type: Full-Time/Direct-HireLocation: Tamarac, FLJob Summary:* The Senior Cost Accountant is primarily responsible for the inventory costing, accuracy, processes, month end close, and analysis.* The ideal candidate will have a proven track record performing cost accounting functions in an operational/manufacturing environment working with Corporate and Production Management personnel.* This person is adept at researching, compiling, analyzing, and interpreting data. SAP implementation is a plus. title: Sr RedHat OpenShift SME
description: w2-$65   Nature Of business is Such - Need Contractor to Be NON Visa dependant & On our W2   Job title: Sr RedHat OpenShift SME Location: New York, NY (Remote option allowed)  Role: RedHat OpenShift Platform Administrator Primary Skills: RedHat  Role: RedHat OpenShift Platform Administrator with Mas8( Maximo) implementation experience Primary Skills: RedHat OpenShift Platform Administrator with Mas8( Maximo) implementation experience  Role Description: The RedHat OpenShift Platform Administrator would need to have at least 3-5 years of experience. In this role, you will primarily focus on administering and supporting the OpenShift Container Platform ecosystem for the organization in both AWS public cloud and on premise. This includes managing container tenant provisioning, isolation, and capacity. You will work directly with infrastructure as code-based automation to manage the capacity of the overall platform and deliver new capacity and capabilities as necessary. Having a strong background in Linux administration, virtualization, networking, and security will be required in successfully fulfilling this role; and in providing first class level 3 support. Additionally, understanding application development lifecycles as well practical experience in working with continuous integration and continuous deployment tools as part of the container lifecycle will be useful.  Principle Responsibilities: - Contributes to and supports the corporate Enterprise Container Strategy by Identifying ideas to improve system performance and impact availability. - Manage the container platform ecosystem (installation, upgrade, patching, monitoring) - Assist in change management of container platform for new versions of OpenShift, Hotfixes, SysAdmin tasks, etc. - Cluster capacity management and provisioning through automation of underlying hosts - Provides L3 engineering support - Works with experienced team members to conduct root cause analysis of issues, review new and existing code and/or perform unit testing. - Authors/edits system documentation/playbook(s) - Partners with experienced team members to develop accurate work estimates on work packages. - May serve as a mentor on procedural matters to less experienced internal and third-party team members. - May assist experienced team members with the delegation of work packages.  Experience (Mandatory): - Expertise with the RedHat OpenShift Container Platform + Mas8( Maximo) implementation experience .- Expertise with Kubernetes. - Expertise in RedHat Linux administration. - Expertise working with Docker or similar container technologies. - Experience with AWS cloud PAAS/IAAS technologies. - Experience working with infrastructure as code technologies such as Terraform - Experience in Infrastructure provisioning, monitoring and Ops  Knowledge/Skills: - Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, high demand environment - Excellent oral and written communication skills - Demonstrates strong customer service awareness and orientation - Exemplifies leadership characteristics in support of corporate objectives

title: Cybersecurity Detection Content Developer (Security CSOC)
description: Title: Cybersecurity Detection Content Developer (Security CSOC)Location: Hybrid based out of Vienna, VA or Pensacola, FLDuration: Initial 6 months (with potential for extension) Compensation: $60.00/hour to $80.00/hourWork Requirements: , Holders,  EAD Cyber Security Content Development: Create high-confidence security monitoring content consisting of dashboards and alerts within SIEM and other network security tools (Hybrid/Cloud) to detect threats, suspicious activities, potential incidents, and aid in analytical-investigations. Continuously evaluate and optimize custom and OOTB (out of the box) detection content monitoring various on-prem and cloud service provider environments in support to SOC operations. Serve as lead cyber security content SME for collaboration with various teams for purposes including, but not limited to threat intelligence, hunt operations, red team engagements, identity management, security architecture review, security event logging issues, and detection content management for identifying gaps and enhancing client s cyber security monitoring posture.Log Analysis: Troubleshoot issues in production and other test and development environments, applying debugging and problem-solving methodologies (e.g., log analysis, non-invasive tests). Conduct independent critical thinking to diagnose and analyze threat intelligence data, latest threats and attack vectors, tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) to make decisions on the most effective response and remediation strategies through content development. Perform analysis of log files from a variety of sources (e.g., individual host logs, network traffic logs, firewall logs, and intrusion detection system [IDS] logs) to identify possible threats and vulnerabilities impacting the organization. Documentation and Process Improvement:  Develop technical documents including, but not limited to content creation, content/rule review process, language-specific querying for disparate log sources, network/security visibility issues, detection gaps, SOPs, and monitoring strategies. Continuously executes timely and effective communication across team and management channels regarding tasks completed, roadblocks experienced, and process improvement opportunities identified. Qualifications:  7+ years of experience within cyber security operations and SIEM technologies serving in a senior analyst or supervisory role. Advanced knowledge of content creation concepts, content development management, content testing, implementation, the revision cycle, and cybersecurity threat analysis of complex events. Advanced skills in monitoring and analyzing logs and alerts from a variety of different technologies and sources, to include but not limited to IDS/IPS, firewall, proxies, network/host, antivirus, OS events, application/database, EDR, NDR, Cloud (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS). Advanced skill in developing complex detection content using various data sources and query languages - e.g., custom SPL (macros, lookups, regex) SNORT, YARA, KQL. Experience in analyzing security systems, and how changes in conditions, operations, or the environment will affect deployed monitoring content. Experience in applying cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation). Advanced knowledge of security architectures, devices, proxies, firewalls, and system and application security threats and vulnerabilities (e.g., buffer overflow, mobile code, cross-site scripting, Procedural Language/Structured Query Language [PL/SQL] and injections, race conditions, covert channel, replay, return-oriented attacks, malicious code). Advanced understanding of blue team/red team processes and technologies and their applicability to custom content development. Advanced verbal and written skill presenting complex findings, conclusions, alternatives, and information clearly and concisely to all levels of management, supervisors, stakeholders and vendors through advanced research, analytical, and problem-solving skills.Required Qualifications:  Experience with security tools related to IPS/IDS, Antivirus, Firewalls, Proxies, DLP, Forensic Analysis, Malware analysis, SIEM, Cloud, and the content development lifecycle. Advanced skill in analyzing log events for on prem and cloud technologies to facilitate development of cyber defense detections.Desired Qualifications:  Splunk Power User, CySA+, CASP+, CISSP or other related Information Security certifications. Bachelor s degree in cybersecurity or related discipline. Advanced knowledge of IT security standards and frameworks (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK) Our benefits package includes:  Comprehensive medical benefits Competitive pay, 401(k) Retirement plan  and much more! title: Project Manager (Onsite)
description: DPP is seeking a Project Manager for an opportunity in Tallahassee, Florida. Work arrangement:  Onsite. W2 position; 20 months.  Job description:  The Project Manager will shape priorities, and coordinate interaction with the customers, users, and stakeholders to keep the project team focused on the right goals for the organization.  Top skills: Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification 4 years of experience leading and managing projects  Responsibilities:  Provide project management for all technical projects following the organization s information system development methodology Rational Unified Process and project management best practices as detailed in the Project Management Body of Knowledge and the organization s Project Management Office as assigned by the organization. Create, maintain, and refine detailed project plans (including work breakdown structures), tracking project schedules and technical performance and leading both the business and technical teams as assigned by the organization. Assist with the allocation of resources as assigned by the organization. Coordinate interaction with the customers, users, and stakeholders and to keep the project team focused on the right goals as assigned by the organization. Follow a standard set of practices that ensure the integrity and quality of project artifacts as assigned by the organization. Develop and maintain a project plans and tasks assigned to technical team and users as assigned by the organization. Provide research and analytical services for systems as assigned by the organization. Meet with the program offices to collect user requirements for new systems, or enhancements to existing systems as assigned by the organization. Develop screen layouts for new systems, or enhancements to existing systems as assigned by the organization. Develop work estimates for system enhancements or new development as assigned by the organization. Coordinate system acceptance testing with program offices as assigned by the organization. Develop documentation as assigned by the organization, i.e., diagrams, flow charts. Perform testing on system changes to meet user-defined requirements as assigned by the organization. Facilitate user acceptance testing with the business program staff as assigned by the organization. Provide management with system status as requested as assigned by the organization. Produce detailed accounting of hours worked by tasks as assigned by the organization. Facilitate meetings with technical and program staff as assigned by the organization (i.e., scheduling meetings, document decisions, identify issues and action items). Produce work estimates to implement user-defined requirements and system changes as assigned by the organization. Produce status reports on the implementation of user-defined requirements as assigned by the organization. Provide analytical services on the organization s IT processes to identify operational efficiencies as assigned by the organization. Provide analytical research to satisfy queries requested by the Legislature and the organization management as assigned by the organization. Follow The organization IT processes and coordinate with other the organizational IT staff to ensure compliance with the organization s standards as assigned by the organization. Correspond (verbally and in written formats) with project teams, internal stakeholders regarding project activities, deliverables, and status as assigned by the organization. Coordinate efforts with the Contract Manager to achieve cost savings under this agreement, where feasible and practicable, as assigned by the organization. Those efforts include, but are not limited to, identifying common system errors in systems that can be resolved in a manner that achieves cost savings in the state. Any cost savings identified must be documented included as part of the monthly status report.  Required knowledge, skills, and abilities:  5 years of experience in developing and maintain detailed project plans (including work breakdown structures). 5 years of experience in meeting facilitation and documentation. 5 years of experience creating and presenting internal and external status reports and detailed status reports suitable for presentation to the Legislature or Steering Committee. 5 years of experience with Budget and Financial Management including Cost Analysis/ Cost Benefits. Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification and 4 years of experience leading and managing projects.Risk Management: 5 years of experience with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) methodologies and documentation. 5 years of experience with risk tracking, mitigation, and issue tracking. 5 years of experience using Microsoft Project to track and maintain projects.Project Deployment: 5 years of experience in leading project teams and effectively conduct the project to meet project objectives. 5 years of experience in delivering the project in the agreed schedule, to the correct technical specification (i.e., defined to meet user requirements) within the approved budget and other specified criteria. DPP offers a range of compensation and benefits packages to our employees and their eligible dependents. Call today to learn more about working with DPP. title: Project Manager PMP
description: Project Manager PMPJob Summary: Talent Software Services is in search of a Project Manager PMP for a contract position in Richmond, VA. The opportunity will be nine months with a strong chance for a long-term extension.Position Summary: The Senior Project Manager will be responsible for successfully planning, organizing, and motivating diverse project teams throughout all phases of Waterfall, Agile, and Hybrid projects, and for delivering projects that provide exceptional value to the Commonwealth's internal and external stakeholders.Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities: Coordinate vendors and consultants, and client's IT and business staff as assigned, in the execution of IT projects and related procurements. Coordinate and oversee the development of proposals, statement of work, statement of requirements and RFP responses. Assist in team development while holding teams accountable for their commitments and removing roadblocks to their work. Facilitate multi-disciplinary teams in the development of plans, goals, objectives, policies, and procedures for completion of a project. Oversee and manage execution and/or coordination of day-to-day project activities as required. Manage working relationships with key stakeholders, including executive management, business management, vendors, project sponsors, suppliers, and technology management. Set project goals that are consistent with technical objectives and the agency's overall technology strategy. Track and communicate a project's progress from a schedule, cost, and risk perspective to the project team, customers, and project stakeholders. Collaborate with technology leads and solution architects to incorporate agency best practices into project plans. Drive consistent project delivery through the entire project lifecycle, including, execution of procurements, definition of project plans, resource allocation, management of project risks, scope, and schedule, delivery of value, and well-ordered transitions to operations. Monitor progress by third-party vendors and define and measure their progress with metrics. Develop and maintain project budget, plans, task lists, schedules, risks, and status, to include resource allocation and schedules. Adhere to project management practices and governance requirements. Exhibit significant emotional quotient (EQ) in handling project challenges and maintain a positive project culture in line with client's mission and shared values. Additional responsibilities as assigned.Qualifications: The candidate must have a minimum of 10 years of experience managing large projects and a bachelor's degree. Fluency in Project Management tools such as Microsoft Project, Visio, and Office required. PMP Certification through PMI or Qualified under Commonwealth of Client Qualification Standards for IT Project Managers. Experience with client's Commonwealth Technology Portfolio (CTP) system and ECOS process is strongly preferred. Experience with Project Management Office methodologies and practices is strongly preferred. Experience with the core Commonwealth IT procurement processes (RFP, VITA Statewide Contract, and CAI SOW) is preferred.Preferred: Strong experience in developing, executing, and managing cloud hosted SaaS implementation projects. Strong experience leading the business and IT resources through the discovery and documentation of business and technical requirements in request for proposal and statement of requirement formats. Strong analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills. Exceptional interpersonal skills for collaborating and team building. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the demonstrated ability to simplify and briefly, succinctly communicate complex issues to multiple audiences. Ability to lead others to implement new approaches, systems, structures, and methods. Ability to define and balance the competing demands for quality, scope, schedule, and cost. Communicate timelines and expectations to technical and business staff. Ability to analyze and document system processes. Solid understanding of software development life cycle models. Exceptional knowledge of both Agile and Waterfall project management principles and practices. In addition, the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a particular project and business environment. Knowledge of process engineering and re-engineering techniques and practices.If this job is a match for your background, we would be honored to receive your application!Providing consulting opportunities to TALENTed people since 1987, we offer a host of opportunities including contract, contract to hire and permanent placement. Let's talk!

title: Enterprise Data & Analytics Delivery Lead
description: Our client, a clothing company, is seeking an Enterprise Data & Analytics Delivery LeadLocation: Hybrid, Bridgewater, NJPosition Type: Full TimeJob description:  The Lead, Business Intelligence Delivery & Support serves as a subject matter expert (SME) across application capabilities overseeing the deployment of recommended analytic solutions that take advantage of a global data model ingesting complex data, visualization tools and techniques to provide insights throughout the employee journey. With focus primarily on adherence to SLA and establishing protocol, escalation and communication of SLA breeches, the role will enlist the right teams, departments, and resources to help resolve the problem. As users interact with the Analytics platform, you will monitor their usage and develop adoption strategies to drive appropriate use, direct users to required training and oversee opportunities for innovation. What You'll Do Collaborate with Product teams, on/offshore development teams and end users to establish, meet and exceed Service Level Agreements for platform availability, issue resolution and upgrades Monitor defects, usage logs and other performance KPIs, driving initiatives that strategically address all and ensure the platform is always performing optimally and end user impact from defects is kept to a minimum Own the adoption and how users interact with the Semantic Layer, its ongoing health, scalability, and performance, ensuring continuous improvement efforts are strategically aligned and planned with focus on driving positive end user experiences and overall platform stability  Partner closely with Product Managers and BI Solutions lead to understand roadmap and backlog of analytic solutions and lead the sequencing and delivery of analytic solutions via onsite and offshore teams Lead the construct of a communication and messaging plan that highlights defects, upgrades, migrations etc. so end users are kept informed of changes and situations that may impact their working day Partner closely with Data Engineering leads to evolve the evolution of analytic solutions in tandem with the data lake evolution - with new data, data model extensions and exceptions Partner with Lead, Business Intelligence Solutions to ensure offshore development SLA's are met and that available skillset flex's with incoming initiatives and roadmap deliveryQUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:Experience:  8+ years' MicroStrategy experience delivering self-service analytics, insights, KPIs and metrics in a BI or related role (Reporting, Analytics, Statistics, etc.) 3+ years' experience in quantitative role in data, reporting, and analytical problem solving 5+ years' experience writing complex SQL queries to drive analysis and insights Production level experience working with MicroStrategy, Data Lakes, Data Bricks among other technologies Strong client-facing written and oral communications skills Familiarity with agile software delivery methodologies such as Scrum Self-driven individual with a bias for action and a passion for analytics Adept at data prep, data modeling and data visualizationEducation:  An undergraduate degree in technology, information systems, data analytics or equivalent degreeSkills:  Cloud Environment: Microsoft Azure preferred, AWS/Google Cloud Platform accepted Data Management: Azure Data Factory, Data Bricks, Mulesoft, Synapse, Delta Lake, BI & Visualization (Semantic Layer): MicroStrategy required Programming/Scripting: Python, "R , Jupiter Notebook Ability to use core analytical methods in developing solutions and design of experiments Segmentation/clustering techniques Predictive modelling Machine Learning Project ManagementSalary: $140k base + 7.5% bonus*M

title: Cloud Engineer (Remote)
description: DPP is seeking a Cloud Engineer for an opportunity with a client in Lansing, Michigan.Work arrangement: Remote W2 position; 12 months with possibility of extensionPosition description: The Cloud Engineer will wear multiple hats assisting the client s Cloud Architects to comprehend objectives, generate solutions, POC the solution, generate recommendations then implement the decisions. As a Senior Cloud Engineer, we are looking for three different candidates who will be involved in the design, implementation and management of technology-based business solutions based on Cloud Services to improve our clients delivery approach. The Cloud Engineer will assist with the build out of a multi-cloud environment such as the public, private, and hybrid clouds. This professional draws on solid knowledge of the company s cloud architecture and platform when designing and developing dynamic cloud solutions.Top skills: Solid knowledge of concepts of designing and developing dynamic Cloud solutions and moving parts involved in continuous integration and delivery. Solid understanding and skill DevOps, web services and application programming interfaces (APIs). Experience with Tooling and Automation to enable seamless automation of infrastructure provisioning and configuration.Responsibilities:Core Competencies Design and deliver secure cloud solutions on Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform. Strong understanding of Linux OS. Chaos engineering experience Strong understanding of virtual networks and general network management functions. Solid knowledge of concepts of designing and developing dynamic cloud solutions. Solid knowledge of concepts and moving parts involved in continuous integration and delivery. Expert guidance to development teams regarding infrastructure. Interpret and provide solutions on complex technologies/architectures. Cloud Formation / automation / Ansible / PowerShell / DSC / Comparable Linux scripting. Experience equivalent to site reliability engineering, DevOps, and/or DevSecOpsCore Tasks Provide strategic and architectural support representing Design Services and the client s Cloud Strategy as a Subject Matter Expert. Identify and prioritize critical business functions in collaboration with organizational stakeholders. Build and maintain relationships across organizational teams. Consult with vendor product specialists/sales, independent research organizations, on-site support engineers and fellow architects and administrators on best-fit technologies to ensure compliance to department policies & standards and technology roadmap. Coordinate with Enterprise Architecture team for technology validation or suggestions for alternative solutions. If necessary, initiate Solution Assessments, Infrastructure Service. Requests, and any applicable required documentation to implement new technology. Advocate the use of emerging cyber security best practices, technologies, developing standards and procedures, promoting the usage of automated tools, developing strategies, and aligning practices with enterprise strategic initiatives. Lead the development of technical artifacts including Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM), Detailed Technical Design, Security Architecture Plan, Services Description Document, etc. Produce architectural framework documents (i.e., white papers, guidance documents, best practices, technical reports, etc.). Project contributor representing architecture and participates in project plan development. Leverage broad-based understanding of technology areas and end-to-end knowledge of current installations to craft architectural solutions or standards that can be applied across the enterprise. Define and build hypothesis around steady state behavior. Run experiments around real world events to define potential impact or estimate frequency. Build automation into systems to drive both orchestration and analysis. Provide support and subject matter expertise with respect to adherence to best practice security framework controls and other industry-based regulatory compliance requirements (e.g., NIST 800-37, 800-53, 800-171, 800-204, 800-207, CIS, PCI, IRS-Pub 1075, CJIS, and related). Assist with cloud infrastructure design and develop detailed architecture models for the client to host test, development, and production environments. Communicate complex technical concepts to individuals of various technical ability. Design and develop cloud cost management solutions. Provide performance analysis & troubleshooting. Design and test large-scale workload and data migrations. Provide direct support to technical and non-technical entities to define requirements and deliver solutions to meet organizational needs including new environment deployment, upgrades, performance tuning, testing and disaster recovery. Integrate cloud services with on-premises technologies from Microsoft, Dell, EMC, HP, Nutanix, Cohesity, Pure Storage, VMware, Cisco, and Rubrick.Required knowledge, skills, and abilities: Senior Cloud Engineer (3+ years) Solid knowledge of concepts of designing and developing dynamic Cloud solutions and moving parts involved in continuous integration and delivery. (3+ years) Guidance to development teams regarding infrastructure (3+ years) Experience with Servers, Infrastructure, Platform Sizing, Infrastructure Cost Reduction (3+ years) Cloud Architecting for cloud infrastructure (3+ years) Clear and concise written and verbal communication is crucial to success and productivity in this role.Highly desirable knowledge, skills, and abilities: Create, maintain, and troubleshooting skills for cloud infrastructure Azure MCSE: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure Cloud security experience Chaos engineering experienceCertifications: Google Professional Cloud Architect AWS Solution Architect ProfessionalInterested? title: Network Engineer Consultant.
description: Net2Source Inc. is an award-winning total workforce solutions company recognized by Staffing Industry Analysts for our accelerated growth of 300% in the last 3 years with over 5500+ employees globally, with over 30+ locations in the US and global operations in 32 countries. We believe in providing staffing solutions to address the current talent gap  Right Talent  Right Time  Right Place  Right Price and acting as a Career Coach    Network Engineer  Consultant. Job Requirements:   Gather project requirements and then create network designs that meet requirements.  Develop and maintain network support documentation, including diagrams, procedures, and configurations.  Implement network infrastructure solutions using firewalls, routers, and network switches with a focus on Palo Alto Firewalls and Cisco Network Switching  Design solutions that support include Cloud Networks  Experience with cloud platforms AWS and Azure  Collaborate with other IT staff to ensure smooth integration of network systems with other business applications and technologies. Knowledge of security best practices and experience with firewall configuration and management.  Experience with network automation leveraging Infrastructure as Cloud languages such as Terraform, and orchestration tools such as Ansible or Puppet   Strong written and verbal communication skills    Employment Opportunity Statement: Net2Source is an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Sr Cost Accountant
description: Our Client, an world's largest conveyorized car wash equipment manufacturer is seeking for an Sr Cost Accountant.Position Type: Full-Time/Direct-HireLocation: Tamarac, FLJob Summary:* The Senior Cost Accountant is primarily responsible for the inventory costing, accuracy, processes, month end close, and analysis.* The ideal candidate will have a proven track record performing cost accounting functions in an operational/manufacturing environment working with Corporate and Production Management personnel.* This person is adept at researching, compiling, analyzing, and interpreting data. This position reports directly to the Cost Accounting Manager.Responsibilities:* Partners with key internal customers (i.e. operations, manufacturing, purchasing, marketing, and Engineering)* Own costing at both plant and item level* Review departmental expenses monthly including the preparation and review of monthly management reports as well as special/ad-hoc reporting projects* Applies cost accounting principles to establish and maintain standard costs, labor, overhead, and add on rates* Analyze manufacturing margins, cost information, absorptions and variances in SAP* Utilize SAP to maintain master data, understanding underlying report data sources* Ensures inventory is properly valued including assessment of variances and inventory reserves* Tracks and compare inventory results with general ledger balances* Oversees inventory cycle count process* Be the on-site point person for back-office process questions* Work closely with the central controllership function and other various off-site corporate departments to implement processes and controls locally on-site* Reviews inventory dispositions and adjustments* Provides management with reports and suggests actions for improvement* Participates in period-end and year end close process* Assists in capital project scope and planning (manufacturing), and preparing financial justification* Assist with audit requests from external auditors* Document workflow and work procedures* Periodic travel to the US may be requiredQualifications:* Bachelor's Degree required, with a concentration in Business, Accounting or Finance; CPA/CMA/CA a plus* 3 - 5 yrs. of operational accounting experience required* 3+ yrs. prior experience in a cost accounting manufacturing environment required* Must have experience with Cost Accounting & Inventory Management* Understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Procedures* Experience with SAP required. SAP implementation is a plus. Familiarity with QuickBooks a plus* Advanced skills in MS Excel Required* Must understand and have experience with standard costing, bill of materials, routings, absorption variance analysis, and overhead allocations*M
